I am a freelancer arty person who works in the media. 

I look forward to welcoming you to my home.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions regrading my apartment.

column7: Modern inner city 3 bed eco house
column16: Hi, my husband and I have lived in Bristol for 35 years and are able to advise on local facilities and recommend places of interest for you to visit. We are widely travelled and have an appreciation of home from home comforts. We have brought up our two children here while working and renovating this idyllic retreat. We welcome you to join us in this unusual sylvan setting and welcome suggestions to make your stay even more comfortable.

column7: Lovely big house with great garden and parking
column8: A very lovely four bedroom home, with a huge eat-in kitchen and sunny, large garden. The whole house has recently been refurbished and the kitchen extended and replaced with a big eat-in space, island and bi-fold doors. It is located in a great part of the city. We are near the Gloucester Road, with terrific independent shops and restaurants, 2 miles from the city centre and minutes from the Downs. Newly converted loft. Woodburner in main sitting room and decked area in garden with table & bbq.
column9: This is a family-friendly neighbourhood with great places to eat, drink, relax and shop. It's close to the city centre and access to the M5 motorway is fast as we are the right side of the city. You can explore the Mendips and the Cotswolds easily, plus much more.
column16: I love exploring new places with my family. As well as using airbnb, we've houseswapped in the UK and overseas more than 50 times in the past seven years.

column7: Entire family home near city centre
column8: This bright and stylish house is located in the friendly bohemian area of St Werburghs, only a 20 minute walk to the city centre.
column9:
St Werburghs has lots to offer including three excellent pubs, a city farm and farm cafe, and a fantastic organic supermarket (The Better Food Company).

The main row of shops (Mina Road) is a stones throw away from the house and has a selection of take-aways and restaurants.

If you fancy a bit of the outdoors, Mina park is just around the corner and there is a community garden leading to 'strawberry hill' with a beautiful view across Bristol.

The popular areas of Stoke's Croft and Gloucester Road are also in walking distance (15 and 25 minutes respectively) and offer some great bars, restaurants, pubs and shops.
column16: I am a natural host and I take great pride in my home. I enjoy cooking and baking and guests are welcome to use any of our many cooking and baking books and equipment during their stay. I will also leave some home baked goodies as a welcome gift.

column7: Family home in central Bristol
column8:
Our lovely family home is spacious, comfortable and well-equipped. It has 5 bedrooms - 4 doubles and 1 single. We are 30 minutes walk from the main waterfront, Cabot's Circus, Clifton, Bristol University and Park Street.

Our Gloucester Road neighbourhood is very cosmopolitan with restaurants, cafes and bars.
column9: The immediate neighbourhood is very quiet. However, the Gloucester Road is two minutes walk, and has a wide range of shops, restaurants, cafes, bars and pubs.
column16:
We live in Bristol - European green capital in 2015!

I travel quite a bit through work, but also work from home, running an educational business with my wife. We work hard, and like to travel when we can. 

As a guest, I'm a relaxed person, and we'd be respectful of your home. 

What else do you want to know? Ask...

column7: Beautiful spacious house, prime location!
column8:
Beautiful large Redland house, peaceful road.

Includes:

Home cinema with 70" screen and full surround sound.
Large kitchen-diner with table for 10 and bi-folds to patio.
Tumble dryer.
Formal living room.
Large master bedroom with ensuite.
1 off street parking space and 1 parking space across this.
10 minutes to Whiteladies Rd/Gloucester Rd.
2 minutes to Redland train station, trains to BTM and London.
Lovely quiet leafy area, parks, gym and swimming pools all within walking distance.
column16:
We're a family who love to travel. We rent out our own apartment, love hosting and always treat where we stay like our own home.

Bristol has been home for us for 12 years now and we love it's amazing mix of music, culture, events and great food.

column7: Large 4 bed house with garden
column8: The main house has 3 bedrooms (2 double 1 single) but basement is converted into a cozy flat with its own kitchen and bathroom (directly linked by internal stairs as well as separate entrance).  Overall two full bathrooms and two further cloakrooms. Off street parking for one car.
column9: Our house sits between the Redland neighbourhood with its large Victorian or Edwardian family homes and parks and the lively Gloucester Road with numerous independent shops, restaurants and bars. There are at several very good restaurants and cafes within five minutes' walk of our front door that cater for lots of different tastes and budgets. The area is convenient for Clifton, the town centre and the M32.
column16: I am an academic at the University of Bristol and am originally from Canada.  Been living in Bristol for over 20 years now.  I am very happy to give you any information or help you require about making the most of your stay in Bristol.

column7: 2 DoubleBed Flat in Victorian home
column8: Spacious 2 double Bedroom flat with own entrance overlooking woodland garden in characterful Victorian family home, features fully fitted modern kitchen, wet room and separate dining area. Close to transport links and 15 minute walk to town centre.
column9:
Montpelier is a lively Bohemian area close to the popular Stokes Croft area of the city lots of Bars and Restaurants close by including the ever popular 'Canteen'. St Werburghs Bristol's Greenest neighborhood is on the doorstep which has a City Farm there are City parks, St Andrews is a particular favourite of ours and cycle paths close by. The bustling Gloucester Road is also within close walking distance.
There is a local convenience store just a 3 minute walk away and an organic supermarket with a cafe just around the corner.

column7: Stunning park-side large family home
column8:
Our large characterful Victorian family home is perfectly placed for a trip to Bristol. Facing a beautiful park and 80m from the independent shops and cafés of Gloucester Road - or a hop further for vibrant Stokes Croft or the city galleries, museums and festivals.

Excellent wifi, music and TV set-up. Great work space if needed.

Please note that there is a cat who lives in the house, we can arrange for him to be in kennels if necessary.

New wet room added in Spring 2023.
column9: Laid back St Andrews is superbly situated for enjoying Bristol  - a peaceful home with so much fun on its doorstep.
column16: Peter and Lucy have lived in Bristol for 15 years and love the city.  They describe their house as a well loved family home ideal for groups or families.  Peter runs a small marketing agency and Lucy dabbles in writing/communications, counselling and interiors. They have a booklet of recommendations of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants  in the city and their beloved Gloucester road which is 200metres away and packed with independent shops and cafes. A beautiful base from which to explore the city. They have 3 children from pre-school to teenage.

column7: Period family friendly home
column8:
Period family friendly home with four double bedrooms, two bathrooms, large living room and kitchen. Double sofa bed in kitchen diner. Quiet location but close to amenities on Whiteladies Road and Gloucester Road. Close to the open space of Durdham Downs.

Garden with swing, slide, seesaw and outdoor dining area. BBQ & fire pit.

column7: Stunning House, Amazing Views, Kid Friendly
column8: We hope you like our lovely house.  Please come and stay.   This house is our home and as such it is full of our stuff so please respect that.  2 double bedrooms for adults and a kids room the can sleep 3 on bunk beds.  We also have a wonderful allotment space out the back with a pizza oven and kids stuff like a slide, trampoline and a nest swing which you are welcome to use.  Search @NaniasVineyard on insta gram and watch some videos
column9: Our house is in a lovely bohemian neighbourhood with a park 50m down the hill from our house.  It's a short walk to the farm shop, a newsagent, a tapas restaurant, 2 fabulous cafes and Italian delicatessen.
column16: JAMES BAYLISS-SMITH is a cameraman and documentary filmmaker currently based out Bristol in the west of England. He has a taste for adventure and is just as 'at home' filming Khazak's hunting with Golden Eagles in sub-zero Xinjiang as he is travelling to the remote presidential palace in the bizarre capital of Naypyidaw to interview the reclusive leader of Myanmar. A member of the Australian Cinematographers Society, James has previously received a cinematography award from the society for his work while shooting for the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC) based out of Beijing, China.

column7: Quirky family home with view and large garden.
column8:
Our home is bright and spacious with a large garden and views over the Frome Valley. It’s a great place for a get together as it has a large, open plan living space. We are a 15 minute bus ride into the centre of Bristol with its great nightlife and family attractions.
We are a large family with a cat and our home is lived in and loved, not a dedicated rental property, so please don't expect everything to be new and matching. Think esoteric and shabby chic, yet clean, tidy and welcoming.
column9:
From the house you can walk out into the Frome Valley where you can often see herons, kingfishers and if you are lucky foxes, badgers or even an otter! Take a stroll around the lake in Eastville Park where there are tennis courts and play areas for the children. You can walk or cycle to the vibrant and multicultural Easton, up to the leafy village of Frenchay or through the valley to Fishponds.
There is also a corner shop at the bottom of the road and a Tesco a 10 minute walk away.
column16:
Hi, I'm Clare and I live here with my big family where we enjoy the countywide whilst being only a short distance from the centre of Bristol.  This is a family home and not a dedicated Air band b property and as such is full of everything you would expect from a home with kids and pets - the fixtures, fittings and decor are not new but they are clean and well loved! We want you to feel at home and encourage you to read our books, watch our DVDs, play with our toys and ride our bikes!  If there is anything you need just ask and I will try to help.  
We hope you enjoy our home as much as we do!

column7: Family home 5 mins walk from uni
column8: A well-loved family home in the centre of Bristol ( 5 minutes walk to the University / BRI / Cabot Circus / Central Bristol) on a beautiful cobbled hill - your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located place. Beautiful rustic garden with outdoor seating.

column7: Beautiful victorian family house - free parking
column8:
Our victorian double bay family home is fantastically located. Just a few minutes' walk from the vibrant Gloucester Road and opposite St Andrews park. 5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms and a spacious kitchen/diner, sitting room and play room and wifi.

Home to Red,one very easy to care for cat who can be sent to a cattery if necessary.
column9: In a quite street very close to the city centre. Head north of the centre to find hip nightlife, independent traders and a bohemian vibe on Gloucester Road and Stokes Croft. Make a stroll around bohemian Stokes Croft, often referred to as Bristol's cultural quarter. Discover unusual shops, great pubs, real clubs, fabulous food and a wealth of artist studios and ever-changing exhibitions.

column7: Clifton - Georgian townhouse for up to 9 guests
column8: Classic Grade II listed Georgian town house sitting in an urban idyll between the river and Clifton village.  Steps from the village and a short walk to the city centre and University with the open spaces of the Downs and Ashton Court 5 minutes by car. An ideal venue for family and friends' weekends away and reunions, we've been delighted to be hosts to a wide variety of families and groups. Our neighbours are great friends and we can’t have any noisy parties, hen or stag gatherings- sorry!
column9:
Our house is in the middle of a close-knit community within the larger city - we have the best of both worlds, green space and peace outside our windows, with easy access to the city centre, University, BBC, theatres, City football ground, station, airport and wider open spaces at Ashton Court and the Downs (all within 15 minutes in the car).
Bristol is a perfect base for visiting the wider south western area (Bath, Tintern, Stonehenge) and Wales.
Be aware that the house is on a steep hill and access is essentially on foot - while you can park one car at the house, there is an element of walking involved, and the footpaths surrounding our little oasis are ancient and charming but they are also hilly and involve some steep steps and climbs (both up and down!). We recommend you park outside the residents' parking zone if you have more than one car. If you’re just here for the weekend we can provide residents’ parking vouchers for another car for £4 a day.
column16:
We're a busy, active family of two lawyers, two children (post-university age) and a lively (12 year old) working cocker spaniel. Both keen skiers and open water swimmers, Anne is a runner and Iain a mountain-biker. There are more bikes in the garage than people in the house ... 
PS it’s ‘iain’, not ‘Lain’!

column7: Large boutique apartment, park views and garden
column8:
A stylish, comfortable, large 2 bedroom Victorian Flat in Arnos Vale located opposite a beautiful park and in walking distance to Temple Meads Station, Bristol City Center, Historic Arnos Vale Cemetry and the vibrant Paintworks. Easy bus routes into Bristol and also Bath.
We love Bristol and if you need help with anything from bus routes to booking the best restaurants, then we are happy to help.
column9:
I love the convenience and ease of getting into Bristol.
You can walk to Temple Meads in 20 mins or into town along a lovely bike path that runs along the river or jump on a bus and 4 stops later you can be at the Harbourside. There is a large Sainsburys 5 mins walk away and a 24 hr garage opposite where you can buy milk and other bits out of hours. There are numerous fast food chains nearby such as KFC, Burger King, McDonald's and Pizza Hut. A little further around the corner is a Marks and Spencer's, Boots, Dunkin Donughts and a Showcase Cinema.
If you keep left and walk for 5 mins you will come to Arnos Vale cemetery which is very historic and houses a tomb of a famous Maharajah. It also has a nice cafe! Opposite there is the Paintworks which is a centrally located creative hub with its own open plan Bar/restaurant Bocabar, who do excellent Cocktails, pizzas an one of my favourite breakfasts in Bristol (open 7 days a week).
column16:
Hi worldly travellers, I’m Jason a restaurant and bar owner from Bristol. 
I love to travel and have holiday homes in Devon and Ibiza. I've been a Airbnb host for since 2016 and really enjoy hosting my places and meeting people from all over the world.

column7: Period Victorian house, big garden, no parties.
column8: The light in the house is wonderful, with a big kitchen/diner looking out over the family friendly garden. The bedrooms are all a great size, high ceilings and with underfloor heating. Gorgeous double glazed timber sash windows throughout the ground floor makes it very cosy. We have lovely welcoming neighbours whom we really want to keep so please, no parties.
column9: This is a lovely quiet, leafy suburb of Bristol, but an easy 40 minute walk to the city centre. Locally we've got the best pizza restaurant - Acapella's - worth booking a table, or just getting take out! Also an amazing corner shop - Star Value. We also have a shopping centre - Broadwalk. Victoria Park, Redcatch Park and Perrott's Park are on your doorstep so it's easy to get out and about. The views from Perrott's over the city are worth seeing.
column16: We are a creative family who enjoy spending time together. We have loads of friends who come to stay, so we're used to extra company.

column7: Unique Converted Warehouse Flat, Central Bristol
column8: This unique open plan 2 double bedroom flat is located in the vibrant area of Old market. People are always blown away by the distinctive design and feeling of space as soon as you arrive in the property. It has the benefit of being an open plan living space and has a cosy, homely feel.
column9:
Old Market is one of the most historic areas of the city. It was the first part of the city to be built around the castle and today is a thriving bohemian shopping quarter in Bristol.

Old Market has a great selection of shops including vintage and antique stores, as well as more contemporary shops. There are also several pubs and bars throughout the area and it is also known for its LGBT-friendly venues. Highlights of the area include The Trinity Centre (2 mins) and Old Market Assembly (4mins). The architecture throughout Old Market is impressive and varied.

The flat is a 15 minute walk from Temple Meads Train station, 10 minute walk from Cabot Circus (a popular shopping district) and 10 minute walk from Castle Park, which you can walk through to get to the City Centre.

column7: Large penthouse flat, spectacular view
column8:
Enjoy spectacular views in this comfortable apartment. Set atop a hill, this period property has panoramic views across Bristol to the Mendip hills, great for watching hot air balloons or fireworks! Nearby is the fabulous St Andrews Park, with its kids play area, café van and lido, well worth a visit.
A quiet flat, yet near to the city centre (0.9m), Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road — ideal for exploring Bristol harbour, the Clifton suspension bridge, or nearby independent shops, cafes and bars.
column9:
My neighbourhood contains beautiful period properties, is near to two parks and on a hill overlooking Bristol. There are some fantastic (award winning Thali Cafe and Bell's Diner) restaurants, bars and cafes nearby on Gloucester Road/Stokes Croft, and in neighbouring Montpelier and St Werburghs. St Werburghs city farm/ cafe and pub come art gallery are all a 10 minute walk down the hill. People are really friendly and helpful around here and there is a great arts scene - with life drawing in a cafe nearby on a monday evening if you fancy sketching.

I'm only a stroll from the gloucester road cafes/restaurants and bars - less than 10 minutes. A bit more boho is Montpelier with the nearby award winning Thali cafe.

The Bristol harbour side with summer festivals, galleries, museums and science centres is 20 minute walk or a quick bus ride.

Keep your eye out for amazing street art murals - there are a few Banksy paintings about the place.

There a
column16: A keen ecologist, teacher, videographer and adventurer. Our home in St Andrews is a retreat for us - quiet and spacious, combining modern technology (WIFI, Smart TV, central heating) with our love of retro furniture and art. The back of the flat overlooks our garden and Bristol city (as I'm atop a hill) and is extremely tranquil. Yet out the front we can leave our front door and be in central Bristol in under 10 minutes. There are plenty of local bars, award winning restaurants, deli's, and cafes here. Stokes Croft and its vibrant night life, or Gloucester Road ( longest independent high street in Europe) are less than a 10 minute walk. As a new Mum I can also attest to the many great spaces and places for babies and young children in Bristol. If you are planning a family trip message me and I can fill you in. Hope you enjoy Bristol whilst you are here as much as we do :D

column8:
A review of this house:-
"Wow....what a stay! The house is fantastic and Kiron was absolutely amazing. She provided a breakfast hamper and a pamper hamper. We got stuck in stand still traffic on the M4 and were going to miss our Asda shop delivery, Kiron waited at the house took it in and put it all away. She went above and beyond. I cannot recommend Kiron and her home enough. Thank you Kiron!"
column9:
~ This is a beautiful house and is on a family estate - we love having families, friends and professionals to stay, however, noise levels must be kept low.

There's a field opposite our house so you could take a picnic rug and chill there or play field games. Please look the house rules especially regarding car parking & noise levels.
column16: My favourite life's saying is "if you change the way you look at things, the things you look at will change".  I'm a positive person and love helping people that's why I'm a Natural Healthcare Practitioner as I get a real sense of glory watching people transform their health and get better and feel better.  My 3 children keep me busy as does my job and when I'm not doing that, I'm on airbnb trying to create lots of lovely experiences with friends and family.  I love just going out and socialising but also cuddling up on the sofa at home with the kids.  Life's about balance!!

column7: Large Cosy House - whole rental / individual rooms
column8:
My cosy house in Redland is close to public transport, family-friendly activities and nightlife. You’ll love my place because of the ambiance, the outdoors space, the light, the comfy beds and the neighbourhood.

The house is available as house rental of all available rooms for families, or for individual rooms for couples or solo adventurers and is suitable for children. There is a cot available. There are 4 bedrooms (3 doubles, 1 single), 2 bathrooms (1 has a shower, one a a bath) plus 1 WC.
column9: The neighbourhood is quiet but friendly with helpful neighbours. It is a lovely place to stay for the holiday season or bank holiday weekends.

column7: North Street Victorian Home
column8: Our house has an open plan kitchen/diner/lounge opening directly into the garden with bi-fold doors, separate large living room and four good size bedrooms. It’s ideally located at the end of North Street, with the Tobacco Factory, Bristol Brewery, Mark’s Bread and Greville Smyth Park on the doorstep. Ashton Court (which hosts the famous Balloon Fiesta) and Bristol harbourside which includes attractions such as the SS Great Britain and the M-Shed are within a 30 minute walk.
column9:
North street is a great base to explore Bristol and the surrounding areas from and is on the doorstep of many of Bristol's great festivals e.g. Bristol International Balloon fiesta, Upfest, Grillstock and lots of more! North Street has a great atmosphere and is full of cafe's, restaurants, pubs and independent shops.

column16: I grew up in London and was lucky enough to move to beautiful rural Wales when I was 10. I spent the next 7 years living in Aberdar cottage. I now live in Bristol with my family after moving from Glasgow and we are really enjoying all that the city has to offer (e.g. great food/festivals/theatre/museums) and access to the beautiful South West of England and Wales.  I love travelling and have been lucky enough to visit South America, USA, Asia, Australia and New Zealand.

column7: The Big Bristol House
column8: Welcome to the Big Bristol House! Our 5 bedroom home is in a wonderfully convenient location in central Bristol. We are just a few minutes walk from Clifton Triangle; filled with restaurants, shops, clubs and bars. Bristol's iconic harbourside is just down the road! While we can't permit parties in the house, we are happy to host stag and hen dos, and there is a huge range of nightlife right on the doorstep! Our comfortable, spacious house is perfect for families or groups of friends.
column9: A large, light, 5 bedroom home in a wonderfully convenient location in central Bristol. Just a few minutes walk from Clifton Triangle; filled with restaurants, shops, clubs and bars.

column7: Bright, Period & Contemporary - Overlooking Park
column8: Our treasured home offers a converted loft master bedroom with ensuite, plus two other bedrooms - and a bathroom. With original features including a working open fireplace in the dining room, wooden floors throughout downstairs, bifold doors opening onto our fairy lit garden & Juliet balcony overlooking the park with playground. Close the to the city farm, great pubs, cafes and restaurants, and a 20 min walk to the centre. Free Street Parking. We just have a cat 🐈‍⬛ that needs feeding 🙏!
column9:
There's a surprising amount of green space considering we're a mile from the centre with some lovely walks to be had. The park has a playground and we are a 10 minute walk from St werburghs City Farm with its EXCELLENT cafe (incredible coffee) and playground next door. We have an amazing butcher and baker called Popti & Beast on Mina Road with coffee to die for, and just down the road you'll find Undercover Rock - a climbing centre in the old St Werburghs church. There are also several very good pubs nearby: the Duke of York is a fantastic fave, and the Farm Pub is also good fun and often has live music, our local cafe Napolita does a great brunch and take aways, new restaurants and loads of arty things happening year round. If you just feel like staying in feel free to watch any of our 200+ DVDs and BluRays on our big telly that swings out so you can angle it for your perfect TV viewing needs!!

There is a post office, a corner shop and several delicious take outs literally

column7: 4 Bed Eco-Home- Winner of 'Best Self Build' Award!
column8: Winner of 'Best Self-Build' award (Structural Timber Association 2016) and featured in Passive House + Magazine, this old jewellery workshop was lovingly re-imagined as a  'upside down' family eco-home, that boasts a stunning, bright open-plan kitchen/diner/living room opening onto a large south facing terrace, and four large bright bedrooms. So well thermally insulated, that even in the depth of winter you only need to heat the house for a couple of hours to keep it cosy and warm all day long.
column9: Montpelier is an extremely colourful, laid back, foodie neighbourhood in the centre of Bristol.  With so much on our doorstep in terms of restaurants, cafes, green parks, music, late night clubs, and general... fun!
column16:
Hi! I've been living in Bristol, on and off, for 13 years and still absolutely love it here.  Our house is down a quiet dead-end street in Montpelier, but only about 50 metres from the chaos and brilliance of Stokes Croft.  We're massively spoilt to be so close to such great music venues, pubs, galleries, fabulous cafes and restaurants and generally just so much exciting, inspiring energy!  

I used to love Bristol for it's incredible freedom and decedent party culture, and now, since having children, I love it even more for it's brilliant parks, museums, community centres and easy proximity to fields, forests and water.  

I feel really happy to share our home with others through airbnb and hope that the space and location will inspire lots of fun, warmth and comfort for those who stay here.  My husband and I designed and built our home in 2015 as a state of art eco home (super-insulted with mechanical ventilation, solar panels and underfloor heating).  We truly love it here and hope you will too.

column7: Victorian House
column8: A stylish, comfortable and spacious three bedroom, three storey house situated just off the bustling Gloucester Rd with its fabulous independent shops, bars & restaurants.  You’ll love my place because of the large kitchen/dining room, the south facing garden and essential off street parking. This is a vibrant area but a quiet neighbourly road with everything close by. It is close to great local, national and international transport links.
column9:
It is a quiet street with lots of families, just one minute from the bustling Gloucester road:
bestof bristol . co . uk /74-things-to-do-on-gloucester-road/
At the other end of the street is Horfield Common, a lovely park with cafe and tennis courts.
There is so much to see and do in Bristol, there are lots of festivals in the summer, there are theatres, the zoo, the aquarium. The harbourside area is fun to visit and you can do boat trips or visit the SS Great Britain or just stop for a drink and look at the boats!
visitbristol . co . uk

column7: Unique spacious houseboat on Bristol Harbour
column8:
Ideal for friends and family get-togethers looking for something unique in the heart of Bristol right on the harbour.
The upper deck provides fabulous views of the harbour from its spacious lounge, balcony, dining area and well equipped self-catering kitchen.
The lower deck has 9 sleeping cabins. Up to 21 beds can be prepared as per your booking request.
As the boat is moored in a tranquil location we insist that guests respect our neighbours by keeping noise to a minimum after 11pm.
column9: Moored on Wapping Wharf close to the SS Great Britain, M-Shed Museum and the trendy Bristol Cargo Quarter.

column7: Spacious house in a vibrant area of Bristol
column8: A delightful Victorian terraced house in Bishopston, a three minute walk from the famous Gloucester Road with its many cafes, shops and restaurants.  It is close to the city centre and a short train ride from Bath. There are two storeys with 1 reception room, a large airy kitchen diner, 3 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, a walk in shower and a separate toilet and garden at the rear. Ideal for families or individuals for short or long stays and situated in a  charming peaceful part of Bristol.
column9: This house is a peaceful place to stay and is an excellent space for people to enjoy the vibrancy of Bristol and retire to somewhere quiet. It is a really friendly neighbourhood with excellent pubs, cafes, charity shops and restaurants. The Gloucester Road, which is minutes away on foot is famous for being one of the longest roads full of independent shops in Bristol.
column16: I moved to Bristol from North London 20 years ago with my wife and two children. I’ve never looked back. I love Bristol and all it has to offer. Come and see for yourself!

column7: Elegant Victorian house:iconic views across city.
column8:
Stunning views from a Victorian terraced house on England's steepest street. 3 bedrooms with a balcony, garden and large open plan kitchen with bi-fold doors onto the garden. Pet friendly with several parks nearby.

Based in Totterdown, a vibrant community which is easy walking distance to the centre, Whapping Wharf, Temple Meads train station with bars, cafes, supermarket, street art and several green spaces all close.

Perfect for a family friendly city stay.
column9: Totterdown is a brilliant vibrant creative community, with bars, restaurants, a greengrocer, high street supermarket and cafes all within walking distance.  Several lovely open green spaces (nearest park 3 min walk away) and a chilled atmosphere.
column16:
Hey, I'm Helen.  I take great pride in my houses and their style, design and comfort.  Both have one thing in common - fantastic views and brilliant close by walks.  

I'm married with two children,  two dogs and two guinea-pigs!  I love travelling, road trips in particular and ski when I can.

column7: Victorian family house with stunning city views
column8: Our home is a 20 minute walk to the centre and harbour. We are next to a large park, supermarket, public transport, local pubs, shops and restaurants, city farm and swimming pool.  Our home is a 3 bedroom Victoria terrace house with stunning views nice garden in a lovely residential neighbourhood. Our home is perfect for families and couples. We have 2 double bedrooms and a children's room with 2 loft beds.
column9:
We live in Windmill Hill which is a lovely neighbourhood.
We are 2 minutes away from a large park with playground and tennis courts.
We are 5 minutes away from Windmill Hill City Farm which has a lovely cafe.
We are 2 minutes away from Bedminster train station which serves local trains.
We have a convenience store in the corner and a large supermarket is 10 minutes by foot.
We have a lovely local pub (The Windmill) and also The Victoria Park Pub is 5 min away.
column16:
Hi! I am Spanish and live in Bristol, UK with my husband Jeremy and our 2 children: Elia and Otto.
We love to travel and being outdoors.

column7: Large very central 4-story townhouse - Big Groups!
column8: Welcome to Stokes Croft the colourful Bohemian quarter of Bristol. The house is right in the thick of it, one of the largest and central places on Airbnb perfect for groups, its a short walk to awesome bars and restaurants. The 4-storey pad has loads of space for large groups. Base price covers 14 guests its £49 per person per night after this number. Superfast Wifi throughout. Massive kitchen, comfy beds, lounge with 65" TV with PS4/Wii. The large South facing garden has a gas BBQ.
column9: The house is located a short walk from the main bus station in an area that has been recently voted the 5th coolest place to live in the UK by The Times paper. It lies between two areas Stokes Croft and Cabot Circus. Stokes Croft and the Gloucester rd are jam-packed with local, independent shops, cafes and restaurants there are so many great places to explore my favourite spots are Poco for amazing Tapas, the new place to go Jamaica street stores for a taste sensation (if you can get a table!) or grab some food at the canteen check out the Banksy and breakdancing Jesus before catching live music every night from 8pm followed by late night dancing at no. 51, or the Love Inn till 4am!. This whole area is full of street art and has the most independent shops of any street in the country. Cabot Circus on the other hand is the new modern shopping centre with a huge selection of designer shops, chain restaurants and a Cinema du Lux. A short walk past the Bus station and the infamous Bear Pit
column16: A keen easy going traveller, there aren't that many places I haven't been. Love music, cinema and food. Always smiling and enjoy meeting new people. An experienced host with over 1.5k reviews :)

column7: 3 bedroom Bristol family house in great location
column8: Visit Bristol, Bath and the Cotswolds from here. Go to the summer balloon fiesta, see Brunel's Clifton Suspension Bridge, the SS Great Britain and Bristol Zoo Gardens.  This light and beautiful 3 bedroom Victorian house with high ceilings combines a great location walking distance from the city centre/Clifton with a peaceful leafy residential area. Redland station is right near by. Enjoy a home away from home!
column9: The house is set in a beautiful green leafy neighbourhood but you can walk into the centre of Bristol in 15mins and to beautiful Georgian Clifton in 10mins. This is a quiet residential neighbourhood and hence unsuitable for events and parties. It is 5mins walk from the cafes, restaurants and shops of stylish Whiteladies road. You can buy food at many shops and supermarkets nearby. Nearest shop is 5mins walk. Off street parking at the property is possible (please enquire).
column16: Lucy is an academic working at the University of Bristol. She likes cycling, hiking and theatre/cinema/art galleries. She is up early for a run and does not stay out to party! She and her family and the dog live in Bristol.

column7: Openplan 4 bed Victorian house with Woodburner
column8: Suitable for families and quiet groups only. Beautiful home with large open plan kitchen-dining area, linked to the massive living room and garden. Includes four double rooms: en suite loft room, bay-fronted master bedroom, and two bedrooms overlooking the garden. The living room has woodburner, piano and mini-pool table. This is our family home so includes our belongings, we do provide space for guests storage also.
column9:
A wonderful house located in a quiet yet central area of Bristol. The area bridges Gloucester Road famed for its indie shops and plentiful good restaurants and cafe; and Ashley down an area of allotments leading down to the City Farm in St Werburghs. You can enjoy walks from here down Gloucester road and the eclectic shops & cafes, through Stokes Croft and graffiti central into town. Or down the other side of the hill you can wander past allotments on both sides and what feels like a rural oasis in the city the farm, cafe and farm pub at St Werburghs. We have a great local pub- the lazy dog with local ales, film night and good feelings all round.

There is a Lidl and an Aldi 1km away on Muller Road.
column16:
A devoted yogini with a conflicted urban-rural divide! I grew up in London, now live in Bristol where we run Bristol City Yoga, and love the city life. Have enjoyed living in Wales, rural Ireland, Dorset and other beautiful, wild, dive into the river/sea spots in between. An avid cyclist, usually to be found peddling away, yoga-ing or hanging out with friends/ family including my son Madoc and Tinkerbelle the dog!

I love to explore the UK and the stunning subtle light, but also to get away in the winter (autumn, spring and summer!)

column7: Spacious, comfy entire family home close to centre
column8: A lovely family home for 8 guests (or 6 if you don't want to use the sofa bed in the sitting room). We are very close (7 mins walk, 2 mins cycle) to Gloucester Road which is the longest street of independent shops in Britain. Also nearby is Bristol city centre, Clifton suspension bridge, the zoo, the Downs, Banksy graffiti/Stokes Croft, Whiteladies Rd, Clifton village,  an independent cinema and many independent cafes/coffee shops.
column9: A quiet area, very close to many amenities such as Gloucester Rd shops, cafes and bars, the city centre and Cabot Circus, Stokes Croft, Clifton and the Suspension Bridge, Bristol Zoo, Redland, The Downs, local cinema, at least 4 good theatres.
column16: Love the outdoors and traveling

column7: Luxury Harbourside Apartment with Balcony
column8:
Welcome to our light and spacious warehouse apartment, situated in the heart of Bristol's historic Harbourside. Only a short walk from the main railway station, the apartment is nestled on a quiet backwater street with minimal traffic, yet still within easy reach of bustling waterfront restaurants and pubs.

The entire duplex apartment is yours to enjoy, complete with its own private entrance and a balcony offering views across the city and the Floating Harbour.
column9:
From the apartment you can walk to all the harbourside and city centre attractions including the SS Great Britain, M Shed, Millenium Square, The Old Vic Theatre, The Hippodrome, Colston Hall, The University, St Nick’s Market and the main shopping area.

A longer walk takes you up the hill to Cabot Tower and to Clifton Village. Close by there are a wide selection of places to eat and drink including local pubs, harbourside cafes and restaurants including the Michelin Star Casa Mia Restaurant.
column16: I have lived in and around Bristol since 1982. I am married to John and have two grown up sons. I recently retired from Local Government and John is an Architect. I love nature, yoga and cycling and like to visit new places as often as I can. We have a converted warehouse in the heart of the city that we make available to visitors to Bristol.

column7: STUNNING city-centre 3 bed. River views + Parking
column8:
Stunning 3 bed apartment in the heart of Bristol's old quarter - surrounded by gastro pubs & live music. Open plan kitchen & lounge with fantastic views gives plenty of space for socialising; 3 generous comfy bedrooms (2 have king sized beds & 1 has a double bed, a 4th mattress can also be made up in the largest room). Everything you'll need for a fab weekend in Bristol is right here!

Please note: Unfortunately due to a recent structural survey, the lounge balcony cannot currently be accessed
column9: The centre of Bristol is vibrant and exciting. On a weekday evening you can take a walk around the harbour and enjoy many different types of buskers, on a weekend you can't help but get excited for what the night has to offer! Jazz - stay local; Pop - go to the Harbourside; Dance, Soul and Grime - Gloucester Road. Bristol has everything you'd want! There is every possible type of restaurant you could wish for from the classic big chains, to independent Michelin star restaurants. There are large open spaces, lots of shopping and entertainment and attractions, on and off the water!
column16: I’m Charlotte, I’ve lived and worked in Bristol for 7 years but work has taken me to London permanently so I’ve decided to rent out my home as I can’t bare to sell it. I enjoy the countryside, the city and harbourside in equal measures and there’s nothing quite like Bristol in the summertime, especially the Balloon Fiesta weekend!

column7: Characterful House with Amazing Roof Garden
column8:
An old shop packed full of colour and character, up a hill in a peaceful location a couple of minutes from vibrant cultural hub of Stokes Croft.
With stunning city views from the roof terrace which has easy access via a staircase and motor operated sky hatch.
column9:
Montpelier was recently voted one of the top 'coolest places to live in the UK' (The Times) . What's noticeable about it how is different all the buildings are .. You get a real sense of that from the roof terrace. There's a real diversity of people and things to do as well .
There's a nice pub just opposite, The Cadbury, with tranquil beer garden and great sunday lunches. Within a couple of minutes walk there are several eateries, with great variety whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner. If you want (guaranteed every night) live music with your food The Canteen on Stokes Croft. Also at the bottom of the road is a farm shop, an Italian deli and a yoga studio.
column16:
I'm easy-going and sociable, and can get along with just about anyone. 
I love music, food and interesting conversation. I work as a music therapist in health care settings throughout Bristol. There are lots of instruments in the house anyone can play if they like. 
I love my home. It is characterful, comfortable and peaceful, and I take a pleasure in welcoming people in to it.

column7: Peaceful, child friendly haven in Bristol
column8:
Beautiful Victorian terrace house, child friendly with garden, indoor games and piano. Near the vibrant high street of by Bristol's famous Gloucester Road - cafes, independent shops. 5 mins by bus to centre, also near the famous St Andrews park with free kids paddling pool and amenities.
Easy access for Festivals and events such as Bristol Balloon Festival and film festivals.
Comfortable home in very friendly area.
column9: Local, friendly area - lots of cafes things to do

column7: Comfortable home in Bristol, easy access to Bath
column8: My house is full of home from home style and character. I have a pretty garden you can sit in during the warmer months and you are welcome to use all the living areas and kitchen during your stay. This is my family home and it has a lot of charm, expect a good standard of cleanliness and the quirks of an old house but if you want a totally pristine 5-star hotel then this is not for you so please don't book. Located on easy routes between Bristol and Bath.
column9: I live in a Victorian terraced house in a busy but quiet street. Parking is free and on-street. At peak times it is hard to find a space so you may need to find a space in neighbouring roads. I mostly find at least one space and during day there is ample parking.
column16: I'm a gardener, designer and part time musician, full time father of two lovely daughters! I'm a very keen road cyclist, runner and squash player. I love to travel with my children, band or just on my own mostly to European destinations and the USA. I also love being at home in my house which I welcome other Airbnb guests to stay in and discover the joys of Bristol.

column7: Lovely Victorian 3 bed terraced house
column8: Fully equipped house located on  a quiet street in bustling Bedminster. Fantastic transport links. Ideal for exploring Bristol. Perfect for pleasure or work visits.
column9:
Our house is located in a quiet street just off of West Street in Bedminster which is located in the South of the City, and has a great vibe. With trendy bars and restaurants of North Street about .7 of a mile and Ashton Gate Stadium about the same distance. We have shops just at the bottom of the street and through a footway, newsagents, café and fish and chip shop.
There is a great climbing centre just a few hundred metres away.
The transport links are outstanding, we have buses and trains galore. If you are driving we can always park on our street and we have no residents scheme.

column7: St Andrews park view
column8:
Our house is a semi detached Bristol townhouse overlooking the beautiful St. Andrews park, 50m from Gloucester Road and Stokes Croft and its famous graffiti.

Our house is light and airy with big rooms many of which have original features and wooden floors.

The ground floor boasts a big kitchen diner and a big old table,next to a log burner.

All rooms have views across city or the park where there is a playground, a paddling pool and a cafe.

We love our home very much and hope you do too.
column9: We live in a quiet, safe Neighbour hood. St. Andrews is very green due to the the beautiful park which has many mature trees, a wildlife pond, a fantastic cafe a paddling pool and a new playground. The house is located quitecentrally so easy access to city Centre as well as the famous Gloucester road which is the uks longest independent high street.
column16:
We are a family of 5. Three boys and 2 adults. We have a dog, cockerpoo, and 2 black cats and 3 goldfish 

I am an Osteopath and work locally in Bristol. My husband Nick is an entrepreneur and is creating an exciting project. The boys are all at school 

We love being at home, cooking ,eating, inviting friends over. 

We love to travel and therefore like someone to be in our lovely house to enjoy it whilst we are away. 

We have lovely Neighbour’s and love where we live. Hope you enjoy our home too and respect the relationship we have with our Neighbour’s!!!

column7: Amazing location - gorgeous  house in Cotham
column8: Our large 4 bedroom terraced Victorian house (205 sq metres) is in Cotham (great location)very close to Clifton, Redland as well as the centre of Bristol. Just round from the corner are the bars, cafes and buzz of St Michael's Hill and Cotham Hill close to the University of Bristol.
column9: Cotham is a great neighbourhood, and very well located. We are very close to St Michael's Hill where there are shops, bars, pubs and restaurants (and a small supermarket). the nearest park for kids is Cotham Gardens a a 10 minute walk away. Bristol Uni close y and you can walk to the centre of Bristol, the harbour etc in 15 minutes
column16: Hi, our names are Simon and Fabiola, and our family lives in Bristol (and part time in Brazil). We love travelling with our 3 young children, swimming, kayaking and SUP.

column7: Quayside townhouse on Bristol's historic harbour
column8:
Residents Parking Zone permits provided free of charge, at least for one vehicle. More than one might be possible, depending on limited stock. There are workarounds if several cars are coming.
No groups of 8 unrelated people please.
This lovely grade 2 listed Georgian townhouse with its central spiral staircase, provides great views of the harbour from three of its four storeys.
column9: This is an historic Georgian terrace,  which forms part of the original docks complex. It is attached to Underfall Yard, which is now a museum, cafe and visitor centre. It is residential and quiet at night, so please do not disturb our neighbours.
column16: I have lived in Bristol for more than thirty years and moved here from Surrey. We live next door, but won't be 'in your hair' , but we will be available for advice and to sort out any issues if needed.

column7: Georgian Townhouse, 3 Berkeley Square, Clifton
column8:
5-Star clean rating with no aircon
A beautiful Georgian townhouse built as a merchant house overlooking Bristol in 1720 nestled in a quiet corner between the City center and Clifton village. We are surrounded by trees and parks, yet right by the University and within walking distance of all the best bits of Bristol.
Having a large open plan sitting/diner and kitchen. It is a perfect place to rent out as a group for someone's birthday or a group of friends 'getaway'.
column9:
This is a beautiful quiet Georgian square surrounded by lovely parks, but you can walk everywhere; shops, clubs, cafes, University, suspension bridge, harbourside.
It is one of the most beautiful parts of Bristol. Nestled between Berkeley Square and Brandon Hill, this city centre location is idyllic. With birds singing songs throughout the day and the hustle & bustle of Queen’s Road and Park Street there couldn’t be a better location to discover Bristol.
Brandon Hill is a wonderful place to get lost in and enjoy nature at its best (in your own backyard!). Discover its waterfalls, woodland and meadow. There's a playground too and the paths lead you all the way down to the river Avon and the centre of town.
Park Street is filled with independent clothing stores, charity shops, and the original Boston Tea Party coffee shop. Try out Pinkman’s, a modern bakery and cafe. There are plenty of wonderful bakeries, cafes, restaurants, and the great Bristol Museum is over the roa
column16:
I've lived in Bristol for 14 years.
I love to cook, travel, DJ and walking our lovely dog Yumi. 

Airbnb has been part of almost every holiday over the last 10 years and feels a privilege to be a super host for 6 years consecutively. 

As a host, I'm discrete but always at the end of the phone.

column7: Spacious , contemporary Victorian terrace, Bristol
column8: Welcome to our spacious, comfortable and homely victorian terrace in Bristol.  The space is welcoming, clean and has everything that you might need for a short or long stay. The location is convenient, it is close to shops, shopping facilities, transport, a cycle path, parks and there is free on road parking.  It’s a short bus ride or drive into the centre of town.
column16: I love art, gardens, travelling, swimming, nature and reading! And lots of other things!

column7: 3 Bedroom Arty Victorian House by the Park
column8:
A bright & comfortable home decorated with beautiful furniture, art, plants, wooden floors & natural textiles.

Dedicated work spaces, coffee maker, kettle & fast wifi.

Stroll through the park to Church Road to find an excellent sourdough bakery, coffee plus other eateries & shops.
We are keen on ecology & use natural cleaning products, reduce waste & recycle.
A quiet street with free on-street parking.

South facing herb garden & bike shelter to the front with space for two bicycles.
column9:
St George's park is my favourite park in Bristol. A beautiful valley setting with interesting varieties of mature trees set around a peaceful lake.

Church road is a few minutes walk away and offers some great shops, artisan organic sourdough bakery "The Loaf" with excellent coffee, bread, pastries + sandwiches. The Dark Horse is a great pub with huge gin selection and local craft brewery ales. The Red Church has great cocktails and live music and The Lock Up is the place for fine food lunch and dinner.

Preserve offers plastic-free zero-waste produce by weight. Southville Deli has your basic goods. There's also various shops, post office & supermarkets nearby.

The river is a 20 minute walk away via Troopers Hill which is a beautiful green look-out point over the city. Conham River park offers a beautiful serene natural space to enjoy the peace and tranquility of the water, birdsong and lush green setting. You may see people kayaking and swimming here in
column41: ["Books and reading material", "Free washer \u2013 In building", "Private patio or balcony", "Dining table", "Freezer", "Wine glasses", "Hot water", "Coffee maker", "Bed linens", "Kitchen", "Hair dryer", "Clothing storage: closet and dresser", "Refrigerator", "Drying rack for clothing", "Smoke alarm", "Iron", "Lockbox", "Bathtub", "Toaster", "Cooking basics", "Outdoor dining area", "Carbon monoxide alarm", "Dedicated workspace", "Long term stays allowed", "Central heating", "Free parking on premises", "Cleaning products", "Self check-in", "Stainless steel oven", "Hangers", "Private backyard \u2013 Fully fenced", "Wifi", "Essentials", "Stainless steel electric stove", "Dishes and silverware"]

column7: higgihaus 46 2-4 Bed Small Groups Hip
column8: Beautifully appointed and stylish large house located in Redland, one of Bristol's most desirable neighbourhoods.
column9: higgihaus@hampton (#46) is a mere stone's throw from Cotham Hill and the Whiteladies Road, both chock full of shops, restaurants, coffee shops, leisure facilities (including a cinema and gym) and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Clifton Down). The Downs (400 acres of amazing parkland) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the city centre is a short walk in the other. Clifton Village, the Gloucester Road, Stokes Croft and the Harbourside are all easily reached on foot. The BBC, Bristol Royal Infirmary and Bristol University are all near-by.
column16:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

We are only 15 minutes walk to Temple Meads Railway station which provides regular links to Bath (only 15 minutes by train), Cardiff (1 hour) and London (1:30hrs approx). Buses run from the end of the road and taxis are plentiful

column7: 3 bed upside down house with views & ample parking
column8: Our luxury townhouse (with living space all on 1st floor) is well located & fully equipped, so whether you want to enjoy the super sociable space in the house with family or friends, or get out on the town to see all Bristol has to offer, you’re covered! Easy access to all amenities - supermarket 300m away, a wealth of places to eat & drink & shop within walking distance, plus direct bus route to city centre & private parking for 2-3 cars. Staying here will give you the best of everything :)
column9: The house is situated in a quiet cul de sac on the edge of Ashley Down and St Andrews, just off Ashley Down Road. It is a ten minute walk to the Gloucester Road via the beautiful St Andrews park with it's large green space and mature trees. The Gloucester Road is a vibrant part of Bristol known for it's wide selection of independent shops, wine bars, cafes and restaurants. A three minute walk downhill in the opposite direction brings you to the eclectic St Werburghs with it's selection of local eateries, restaurants and brewery, and the fabulous (& free) city farm. The house is also located very close to Gloucester Cricket ground (5 min walk) and within easy reach of Filton and UWE (both on a direct bus route).
column16:

I believe in recycling, sharing and smiling :-)

column9:
The Area

Clifton is one of the most ideal bases to explore the charming city of Bristol. The Apartment is located close to some of the best destinations in Bristol, ranging from the Hippodrome to the SS Great Britain, The University of Bristol, Bristol Museum & Art Gallery and other iconic landmarks like the Bristol Cathedral and the Clifton Suspension Bridge.
column16:
Hello! and welcome to our profile.

Your Apartment- Bristol, is passionate about providing unique living spaces that make guests feel more at home than at a hotel. A family run business, we have established ourselves as Bristol’s leading provider of serviced apartments.

Offering a wide selection of boutique-style serviced apartments at affordable prices. These range from studios to 3-bedrooms, with each apartment interior individually designed by our in-house creative team.

column7: Modern & Stylish Eco Home+Garden with city views
column8:
Built by an architect in 2016 as a unique eco-home, this house is modern, stylish, light, and can sleep up to 4 guests. There is access to a private landscaped garden where you can enjoy a BBQ and pizza oven in the summer months.

Located in the stylish neighbourhood of Montpelier (voted the ‘hippest’ neighbourhood to live in the UK), this unique house is only a 15 minute walk to the centre of Bristol and has nearby cafes, restaurants, pubs, shops and breweries within minutes walk of the house.
column9:
Old Ashley Hill can be found between two of Bristol’s most popular areas, St Werburghs and Montpelier. Picton Street, with its extensive range of eateries, is an eight-minute walk through eclectic lanes. Here one can find the highly rated Bianchis Itallian local favourite Oowie Burger, Thali Cafe, and The Bristolian. There is also a fantastic Italian supermarket. There is the famous Wiper & True brewery and tap room 5 minutes walk from the house in the other direction, as well as more pubs nearby.

A few yards more and you find yourself in Bristol’s Heart – Stokes Croft, home of Bristol’s counter culture. In the house’s immediate vicinity are the allotments, St Werburgh’s eco-village and Mina Road’s restaurants including the acclaimed Cauldron. There is also an organic supermarket, Church (converted to a climbing centre) and a number of excellent pubs and breweries all within walking distance.

Bristol's central shopping area (Cabot Circus) is a 20 minutes walk a

column7: Bell Hill House - Sleeps up to 8 with Parking
column8:
The house is modern and has a stylish décor. It has a small but charming garden, three bedrooms and a shower on the first floor, kitchen, bathroom, and lounge on the ground floor. The lounge forms a private sleeping area should groups visiting require four rooms.

The house is suitable for both leisure and business visits to Bristol. It is freshly decorated and well optimised for up to 8 guests, with comfortable beds for resting after a long day.
column9:
Centre of town is a short 10 minutes drive away or a 25 minutes bus ride.
Harbourside - Boats, restaurants and museums are perfect for both professional and leisure use.

Cabot Circus – a semi-indoor shopping area filled with popular retail shops, restaurants, and cinema, great for families.

Stokes Croft – a taste of true Bristol flavour of life, where you can find great pubs, graffiti and delicious restaurants.

St George Park – amazing for a lovely walk or picnic with a pond for a feature in the park. Ice cream vans are often around the skate park area, providing something for everybody in a family.
column16: I am an adventurous and outgoing person. I tend to travel because of the love for food, nature and culture. I also love movies of all sorts and strongly believe that there's always something to explore anywhere you go.

column7: Secluded, large house in the heart of Bristol
column8: Modern, spacious, private and quiet house in the heart of Bristol,  with loads of natural light and large open spaces.  Off street parking with lovely garden set up for great outdoor living. Underfloor heating with gas fireplace for cosy winter nights and days. Easy walking to many of Bristols attractions, not least Gloucester Road, really on the doorstep!  There is a friendly cat in residence who is no trouble at all, she just needs a feed each day..
column9:
Very close to the great Gloucester Rd, one of Bristols greatest streets. A fantastic village feel with all the features you would expect to see that you can lose yourself in.

Many great restaurants from around the world, multiple pubs to choose from, specialty shops and local groceries.
column16:

A lost Aussie living in the UK for over 15 years. have been using Airbnb right from the start for most of my travels and now a host with them as well. 

One of my  lives objectives is to have traveled more countries than my age, so thats a few! 

Love to explore, try new things and meet people along the way.

column7: Lovely Relaxing Bishopston Victorian Family Home
column8: Welcome to our Victorian family home in relaxing Bishopston, near Gloucester Road, the best shopping street in the UK for independent shops, cafes, pubs, restaurants and artisan bakeries. 20 mins by bus to the centre and 20 mins walking to the entertainment district of Stokes Croft. At the end of the street is one of Bristol's loveliest parks, St Andrews Park, with a designated play area and paddling pool. The Times Newspaper rated Bishopston as the best area of Bristol.
column9: Bishopston is one of the most family friendly areas of Bristol and also has the advantage of being seven minutes walk from the bustling Gloucester Road. This high street has cafes, bars, independent shops, restaurants, butchers, bakers and food stores - it's known for being one of the best independent shopping streets in the country. Just at the end of our street is a co-op supermarket which has everything you need at hand, whilst at the other end, just around the corner, is St Andrews Park, great for relaxing, paddling and playing. A nice walk is to the City Farm in nearby St Werburghs, which boasts a very characterful cafe with healthy food, next door to a pub renowned for its Sunday dinners. Bristol is a great place to visit, with the harbourside being especially packed with activities, and is surrounded by lovely countryside.
column16: I like culture, cycling and travelling.

column7: Urban Paradise
column8:
Welcome to our very special, peaceful and colourful home, a haven in the middle of the best city in the UK!

4 bedrooms upstairs sleeping 8 people (two doubles and two bedrooms with bunks, with option of adding travel cots); a cute bathroom; utility room with washing machine; fabulous kitchen/living/dining area; off-street parking; and private patio in a beautiful garden in central Bristol.

Our house is perfect for couples, families with children (young or old), or a group of friends.
column9:
As previously mentioned, your home-from-home is perfectly located for every brilliant thing Bristol has to offer: live music, festivals, the Universities and art schools, galleries and museums, bakeries and coffee shops, restaurants, pubs and bars, and the rich and diverse history of this city on the water.

Our neighbours are the celebrated, world-class St George's concert venue and Brandon Hill, one of the most lovely of Bristol's parks. The spectacular Clifton Suspension Bridge is a walk away and there is so much on offer throughout the year that you won't want to leave.
column16:
I'm Jess and I live with my husband, Sam, our three children, and my mother-in-law... who is also the landlady!  This is her home, and it will be yours too for the duration of your stay.  You will find it to be a most beautiful and magical place to spend time.

This is an open home and we are artists, designers, musicians, cooks, travellers, and writers. The house is a reflection of our creativity and lust for life.

As a family, Sam and I took the children back-packing through Europe and Airbnb was a fantastic way to stay in wonderful places on our shoestring budget.  Now it's our turn to return the favour to others.  We love meeting new people, and welcome you and your stories to fill our home.  

As hosts, we can be on hand if you'd like a hands-on experience, or we'll leave you alone if you'd like some space!

column7: Gorgeous Georgian House with garden in Bristol.
column8: Our 200 year old family home is a beautiful Georgian house with original features in the heart of Montpelier in Bristol. The house is full of art, plants and books, a cat and has a wild garden full of fruit trees. Montpelier is Bristol's bohemian area famous for it's street art.  We're a 5 minute walk away from two excellent restaurants & a 15 minute walk to Bristol city centre.  We have old thin walls so for noise reasons this house is only suitable for families & quiet groups !
column9: Montpelier is a lovely bohemian quarter in the heart of Bristol with great restaurants and street art.  St Andrew's park is just around the corner and within a 30 minute drive you can get to gorgeous Somerset or Gloucestershire countryside and villages.

column7: Heart of Old Town Two bedroom apartment

Made in Old Style way apartment is right in the heart of town, St Nicolas market  - moments from the river walk and few minutes to harbourside and best sights, culture and nightlife of Bristol. column7: Unique Heated Yurt - Secret Garden in the City
column8:
Our beautiful and spacious 7 metre yurt is set in a private acre of woodland in St Werburghs, which is a family neighbourhood in central Bristol with fantastic local amenities. With views of the allotments and bordered by a nature reserve, you’d never know you’re only half an hour's walk to the city centre. Parking is free, with no restrictions on our street. What we offer is basic but beautiful, with a friendly and welcoming reception.

Also check out our Pear and Apple Woodland Pods :)
column9:
The location of our space is a massive bonus. We live in a friendly, bohemian, family community with lots of lovely cafes and restaurants with outdoor seating, pubs, parks, a climbing centre and an organic supermarket.

The site sits in the heart of the unusual Ashley Vale, next to a city farm and surrounded by allotments on one side and a nature reserve on the other. You'd be forgiven for forgetting that you're in the middle of a city with easy access to both the centre and the M32, to get out to surrounding areas.
column16: Hello, I live in Bristol, UK with my two children and my partner Ollie. I’m an advocate for children and young people’s rights in education and universal basic income. Ollie and I are also both drag kings and cabaret producers.

column7: Quiet, spacious period house
column8:
Just over a mile from central Bristol is this oasis of calm - a lovely quiet old stone-built home. You won't feel crammed in here and there are private gardens.
There are several local restaurants within a couple of minutes level walk, including two Michelin listed, and numerous more within 10-15 minutes.
Within walking distance or a short Uber ride of the University, BBC, Downs, Spire as well as just about every imaginable amenity.
Local train and free on-street parking (ask me for permits).
column9:
The house is in the heart of Redland, just off Chandos Road. Redland is an affluent, leafy, sought after area of Bristol which sits astride two very different worlds - elegant Clifton with its famous bridge on one side, with the more Bohemian Gloucester Road, Montpelier, St Werburghs areas on the other. Vibrant, multicultural Easton is just five minutes away on the local train (Stapleton Road station).

Local amenities start a minute's level walk away. The highly-acclaimed Wilsons and Little Hollows restaurants on Chandos Road are both Michelin listed. There's a new upscale bakery on Chandos Road and a local shop. There are wider choices around Whiteladies Road/Cotham Hill and Gloucester Road/Zetland Road, each 10-12 minutes' walk.

The immediate neighbourhood has an eclectic mix of professionals, academics (no student houses in the road) and eccentric creatives. You're likely to hear some of my neighbours play classical music! Apart from that it's extremely quiet.<
column16: Proud custodian of "The Pile" since 1996. No better tranquil respite from which to enjoy this creative, ingenious city.

column7: Large period family house Bishopston, Bristol
column8:
Welcome to our Edwardian family home in the heart of Bishopston.

We are a brisk 20 minute walk to Bristol city centre. The house has a spacious living room with log burning stove, an airy kitchen-diner, utility room, cloakroom plus 3 bedrooms and a family bathroom. Outside there are front and rear gardens.

Despite our proximity to amenities, we do live in a quiet residential area so our house is suitable only for families and quiet groups. Parking is easy -and free- on the street outside.
column9: Our house is a  three minute stroll from Gloucester Road, the longest road of independent shops in the UK,  jam-packed with cafes, pubs, restaurants and artisan bakeries.  We are also a ten minute walk from St Andrews Park, complete with cafe and paddling pool in the summer months! And only fifteen minutes walk from Gloucestershire County Cricket Ground. Walk ten minutes towards town and you will be in graffiti central on Stokes Croft-Banksy and many others have left their mark here.
column16:
We are a small family with two children aged 16 and 13. We love to travel and are always thinking about our next trip!

We live in Bishopston, Bristol close to Gloucester Road, reputed to be the longest street of independent businesses in England. Bristol is a fantastic city and it is a privilege to show a small part of it to our guests.

column7: Modern & cheerful 3 bed family home with parking
column8: Relax with the whole family at this peaceful place to stay with Bristol and Clifton on your doorstep!
column9:
Although our road is quiet it joins the main City roads with frequent buses and plenty of amenities nearby in Stoke Bishop & Westbury-on-Trym.

Business: If you are visiting Bristol on business, you'll be very close to BAe Systems, Rolls-Royce, airbus and Southmead Hospital. A short drive to Aztec West and Cribbs Causeway Mall make this an ideal location.

Leisure: The quaint and bustling villages of Westbury-on-Trym & Henleaze are under 5 minutes in the car and thriving with shops, pubs and restaurants.
Supermarkets: Tesco, Co-op and Waitrose are all within a short-drive.
Horfield, Henbury & Shirehampton Leisure Centres are nearby. Shirehampton Cricket and Golf Course along with Canford Tennis Club.
Playgrounds & Parks: Stoke bishop and Canford Park are a short 10 - 15 minute walk away with amble equipment to keep the kids entertained!
There are beautiful walks and lovely ambling paths close to the house. Try out Blaise Castle and woods and
column16:
Husband and father of two little fox cubs.  We're proud of the family home we've created and welcome you to share it too.

Bristol is such a brilliant city with lots going on, you'll love our secluded family home that is quiet but close enough to the city center to enjoy its delights!

column7: Gorgeous 3 Bedroom Town House In Clifton, Bristol
column8:
This spacious 3 bedroom home is set across 4 floors in the heart of Clifton Village.

It is located just 2 minutes from Clifton Suspension bridge and The Ivy Clifton Brasserie and if you are looking for amazing views of the Suspension Bridge, The White Lion is a great location for a nice meal and a few drinks! The interior is tastefully neutral with some luxurious touches.

It is the perfect base for couples wanting a relaxing stay in the Bristol area and exploring Clifton’s chic boutiques,
column9: Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions, such as Clifton Suspension Bridge and the giant's cave, Clifton is one of Bristol's most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters. Beginning with the Clifton Triangle and reaching into the area affectionately known as Clifton Village, this stunning Georgian area is always hugely popular with visitors.

column9:
Here are some of our favourite places to go! Bristol is very family friendly and most places welcome children. We’ve focused mainly on places in our local area as we love it so much and there are fab options but there of course loads of great places in the city centre and around the harbourside too.

AREAS IN BRISTOL

Bishopston – our local neighbourhood. Lovely parks, great independent shops and a wide variety of places to eat and drink
Clifton – gorgeous Victorian part of town, views of the Clifton Suspension Bridge, especially if you take a walk on the Downs
Centre – lots of shopping and eating here
Harbourside – check out waterside pubs and restaurants or one of the galleries or museums (see more below) or take a ferry ride for a different view.


EATING & DRINKING around Bishopston and Stokes Croft
Breakfast, brunch and coffee
- Hobbs House Bakery – delicious baked goods. You can sit in courtyard garden at back and have

This is our family home - so you will find the cupboards, drawers full and children’s scribbles on the walls and furniture!! But it’s homely and we know you’ll have a comfortable stay.

Southville is a thriving neighbourhood, home to Europe's largest street art festival with
independent bars & restaurants on your doorstep. 10-minute walk to the city centre, 20-minute walk to Temple Meads Train station.

column7: Charming Victorian 3 bed Terrace
column8:
Traditional 3 bed victorian terrace family home in great location. 200 metres from the popular North Street of Southville that features many bars, cafes, restaurants, shops, a theatre and comedy club.
The downstairs comprises of an open plan living/dining room, W/C, kitchen with breakfast table with access to a small courtyard garden.
The upstairs has 3 double bedrooms and a family bathroom.
column9:
There are many great restaurants, bars and cafes close by. Our favourite restaurant is The Soukitchen, we love to shop locally at the deli, greengrocer, fishmonger and butchers which are a 2 minute walk from the house. There is also an Aldi with in a 5 minute walk.

For entertainment check out a show at the Tobacco Factory Theatre or comedy at The Hen & Chicken

It is approx 30 minute walk to the City Centre, 20 minutes to the SS Great Britian and the harbourside.

Ashton Gate Stadium is about 10 minutes walk from the house: The home of Bristol City Football Club and Rugby Clubs as well as a music venue.

column7: Warm and comfortable home in Westbury Park.
column8: My place is fantastic for its location, close to many Bristol amenities, particularly the lovely Clifton Downs. You’ll love my place because it is a home, full of all the equipment you might need for a night in. I offer a cosy, homely space, comfy beds and a small parking space behind the house.
column9: The house is located in the popular village of Westbury Park with its range of unique emporiums, restaurants and cafes on the doorstep.
column16: I have been hosting via Airbnb for about 10 years and I love the opportunity to meet new people and hear why they're using my place. During the week I work at the University of Bristol and when I get the chance I travel quite extensively. I'm happy to let people into my home because I'm proud of Bristol and want others to enjoy it!

column7: Off Whiteladies Rd nr Uni, BBC, Hospitals, Clifton
column8:
A short walk from Clifton Village, at the lower end of Whiteladies Road, the flat is in the bustling heart of Bristol.

There is free on site parking for ONE CAR and its only a 2 minute walk to a number of good restaurants, coffee shops and the local cinema, plus easy access to Redland, Cotham, The Downs, Hotwells and Gloucester Rd.

1 minutes walk to the BBC and less than 10 minutes walk to the Bristol Royal Infirmary, the children’s hospital, St. Micheal’s Hospital and Bristol University.
column9:
Great location to be based for any visit to Bristol, business or leisure.

The flat is walking distance to most of Bristol’s best attractions - the Clifton Suspension bridge, Brunel's SS Great Britain, Bristol Cathedral, the Old Vic or Hippodrome, Cabot tower & Cabot Circus, to name just a few.

1 minute walk to an M&S and the nearest bus stop.

Within 5 minutes you could walk to a larger Sainsbury’s and Clifton Down train station.
column16: We lived in the flat for 10 years+ but family life took over so sadly we don’t live there any more. Its a great place to live, right in the heart of the Clifton area, next to cafes and shops, and a stone’s throw from the BBC and university. Great transport links too being 2mins walk from Clifton Down station and buses running frequently up and down Whiteladies on the door step.

Welcome to our urban oasis in the heart of Bristol!

Our lovingly refurbished 2-bedroom Georgian maisonette awaits, offering comfort, style & a great location for your stay.

The property features a sunny quiet balcony, 2 parking spaces & original features, we provide a truly authentic Bristolian experience.

Equipped to be home away from home, we've curated every detail to ensure your stay is as comfortable as it is memorable. Whether staying for work or leisure, we can't wait to welcome you!

column7: The Alma Taverns' Exclusive Accommodation - Hopewe
column8: The Alma Taven has five brand new stylish en-suite bedrooms to offer, above one of the city’s most iconic pubs on a quiet street in the heart Clifton, one of Bristol’s most stylish districts, and equidistant between the shopping and leisure hubs of Clifton Village and Whiteladies Rd. This listing is to book all five rooms!
column16:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

column7: 3 bedroom Shirehampton flat near Avonmouth & M4
column8:
A first floor apartment in Shirehampton, Bristol which is easily accessible from Avonmouth, the M4 and Bristol and is a welcoming, comfy space. The kitchen is fully equipped and there is a comfy living room with smart TV. The 3 bedrooms have comfy beds and bathroom has a bath and shower above.
Parking is free on street
column9:
Local attractions include Blaise Castle Estate and Kingsweston House. Just a short drive along the Portway, passing under the famous Clifton suspension bridge takes you to the heart of the City, with all its many attractions including the International balloon fiesta and Festival of the Seas.
The property is located near to the M4 and M5 junctions so is an ideal base for exploring the Southwest.
