column7: Fantastic 2 bedroom apartment
column8: This two bedroom apartment is perfect for a holiday getaway or a nice relaxing weekend. It's been newly furnished to be your perfect temporary home. It's close to the city centre - one route on the 75 or 76. Both the A38 and A37 can be reached by car in 2-4 mins. Shops, buses, and all amenities are close. Bristol airport is only 10 mins away by car - no more panic about arriving in time. We know parking is a hassle but don't worry, free parking is available right opposite the flat at all times.
column9: The area is very quiet and safe. The bus stop is less than 1 minute walk which then can take you to the city center,bus (75,76). The bus stop that takes you to the airport is 4 minutes by walking. Bristol Airport is 15 minutes away by bus. We have many shops near by like lidl which is 5  minutes away and the imperial Park which is 15 minutes by Walk.

This great location is close to shops, restaurants, bars and walking distance to the city centre. The living room offers ample space to relax with a feeling of freedom, and catches sun all day through a grand bay window. The grand oak dining table and oak kitchen provides a memorable  experience for couples/groups. See below upgrades due to guest feedback.
column9: The apartment is situated on the leafy Cranbrook Road, which is located centrally and is approx. 100m from the popular area of Gloucester Road, where a number of bars, restaurants and local amenities are available. The city centre is within walking distance and there are also plenty of bus routes from Gloucester Road. The apartment is also within walking distance to Whiteladies road in Clifton, where there are a range of delightful shops and restaurants.
column16: I work in aero engineering and have loved my apartment to bits, enjoying being central in Bristol, though now I have relocated for work. I love to travel and soak up life beyond the working norm, such as dining well and visiting good pubs, listening to live music and visiting interesting tourist sites. This was the key reason for basing myself in the apartment and I hope others with similar interests will enjoy this pleasure too!

column7: Support the homeless & enjoy a cozy family home
column8:
This is our family home, not a holiday let. Please expect a cozy family space with three double bedrooms and a sociable kitchen / diner area rather than a show home.

Off street parking space for 1 car with one more across the drive.

One third of your fee will be donated in your name to Helping Homeless Believe (HHB). HHB is a group of volunteers that exist to support those without a home – a bustling team working every day to provide support to vulnerable people in the city of Bristol.
column9: 10 minute walk to The Greenbank pub - bistro pub of the year.  In vibrant Easton.
column16:
I've lived in Bristol since July 2018 and much like London - there' s lots to do - but unlike London, I also know (and love) my neighbours.

Our social time is spent mostly around the kitchen table and we enjoy a kitchen disco from time to time.

I work from home in the office in the garden.

column7: City Hideaway with hot tub (family/couples only)
column8:
We self built the Little Trooper in 2017 with the intention of achieving a unique, fun and comfortable oasis hid away up a private road in the middle of the City giving a holiday feel to escape the fast pace of City life.

The house has 3 bedrooms that sleeps up to 6 adults and 3 children and is intended to cater for large families visiting our beautiful city.

I think the pictures say it all really and as you will see the house is kitted out with all the extras and luxuries to please everyone.
column9:
The area has lots to offer without having to jump into a car. The local newly refurbished pub is just 50m away and has live entertainment most weekends.

100m away is the nature reserve-Troopers Hill, this is well known locally for being one of the best viewpoints of the City.

A 10 minute walk will get you to the local high st, here you will find a great selection of pubs, cafes and great restaurants.

A 20 Minute walk gets you to an amazing hid away riverside bar Beeses tea gardens, the problem is that its on the opposite side of the river.. however get this.. they operate there own small boat that will pick you up and take you to the bar and then take you back for a fee of 50 pence!! this is a must see if the sun is shinning!!
column16:
I’m Richard,
I am a Bristol based tree surgeon and a small scale property developer.
Also a passionate traveler and love adventure and the great outdoors.

column7: higgihaus 7 Bed Sleeps up to 18 Big Groups
column8: Beautifully appointed and stylish large house  located in Redland, one of Bristol's most desirable neighbourhoods.
column9: higgihaus@hampton (#46) is a mere stone's throw from Cotham Hill and the Whiteladies Road, both chock full of shops, restaurants, coffee shops, leisure facilities (including a cinema and gym) and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Clifton Down). The Downs (400 acres of amazing parkland) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the city centre is a short walk in the other. Clifton Village, the Gloucester Road, Stokes Croft and the Harbourside are all easily reached on foot. The BBC, Bristol Royal Infirmary and Bristol University are all nearby.
column16:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

column7: Lovely basement flat near train station & centre
column8:
Our basement flat is close to Bristol Temple Meads station and the city centre.

It has been beautifully refurbished and equipped with everything you need for a comfortable stay.

The flat is close to lots of lovely independent shops and you will be spoilt for choice for places to eat/drink.
column9:
The flat is located in the Totterdown area of Bristol. This is a mainly residential area, with plenty of independent shops, restaurants, cafes and bars within easy walking distance.

The flat is also close to three parks - Victoria Park is the closest (at the bottom of the road - 5 minutes walk), Perrett's Park is 10 minutes walk, School Road Park is 8 minutes walk.

The flat is 10-15 minutes walk from Bristol Temple Meads station, 25 minutes walk from Wapping Wharf (harbourside), or 30 minutes walk from Cabot Circus (shopping). Alternatively, the flat is close to a bus stop or just grab an Uber.

column9: Clifton & Cotham - Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions, such as Clifton Suspension Bridge and Bristol Zoo Gardens, Clifton is one of Bristol's most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters. Beginning with the Clifton Triangle and reaching into the area affectionately known as Clifton Village, this stunning Georgian area is always hugely popular with visitors.
column16:
Hello! and welcome to our profile.

Your Apartment- Bristol, is passionate about providing unique living spaces that make guests feel more at home than at a hotel. A family run business, we have established ourselves as Bristol’s leading provider of serviced apartments.

Offering a wide selection of boutique-style serviced apartments at affordable prices. These range from studios to 3-bedrooms, with each apartment interior individually designed by our in-house creative team.

column9: my flat is located in the center of Bristol in the heart of SaintPauls' dance and singing district. You have a 5-minute walk to the center, many local cafes and restaurants along the road. There is a bus stop in front of the house.

column7: Lovely Victorian Apartment in Clifton Village
column8: The apartment is perfectly placed just a 5 minute walk from Clifton village where you can find an abundance of independent shops, café’s & bars!  One of Bristol’s most recognisable structures – the Clifton Suspension Bridge is just a 8 minute walk away or you can head to the observatory and take in the views of the bridge and city! The iconic Bristol harbourside is a 24 minute walk away or a fun way to explore the city is to use a Voi scooter!

column7: Large beautiful family home in central Bristol
column8: Large spacious 3 floor family home in St Andrews, Bristol. Central location. 10 mins to center of town and Clifton. 2 mins from local train station. 7 mins from Glouster rd, lovely independent high st with lots of shops and cafes. 5 mins to St Andrews park, Kids play ground and large paddling pool. 6 Bedrooms.
column9:
St Andrews is a very central location. family friendly safe pretty neighbourghood.
15 mins walk in to town, Docks and Harbour, & mins from Glouster rd, tonnes of pubs, restaurants cafes and shops. 1hr from Glastonbury, Great proximity to Devon, Somerset, Cotswalds . 1.hr20 to London on train. 5 mins from M32 motorway.

column7: Clifton Spacious 3 Bed Apt&Parking - Simplycheckin
column8:
*Contact me for last minute availability and/or longer stays* Close to The Downs and Whiteladies Road, Spacious Apartment with Parking For Two Cars (Max Size Standard SUV).

A luxurious, light and spacious 3 bedroom top floor apartment with off street parking for two cars situated in a fantastic location. Easily accessible for Clifton College, Bristol Old Vic Drama School, Bristol University, the BBC, Clifton Village, Bristol Zoo Gardens, Bristol City Centre, Harbourside, shops and cafes.
column9: The apartment is situated on a quiet road in Clifton. Within walking distance are many coffee shops, bakeries, restaurants and trendy bars as well as Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and Bristol Zoo. Also in the locality are Clifton College, Bristol Zoo Gardens, The Downs, Bristol University, BBC Bristol and Bristol Museum. Park Street and The Triangle provide further restaurants, night life and retail shops, you will find the Harbourside and Cabot Circus shopping centre about a 30 minute walk or a short bus ride away. You can indulge in a swim and beauty treatments at the nearby Lido Spa & restaurant, reservations will be needed for treatments. Genuinely a perfect location to explore Bristol.
column16:
Simply Check In are a bespoke holiday and short term let management company.
Our serviced apartment staff aim to supply the very best personal and friendly service to all our guests. You may book in the safe knowledge that we will do all we can to make your stay exceptional.

column7: 3 Storey Town House
column8: Recently re-listed 3 storey town house situated in close proximity to Gloucester road, UWE, Park Way Station and the MOD. Bristol centre is a 12 minute taxi ride, this increases during rush hour but can be replaced by a short 10 minute walk to Filton Abbey Wood train station where trains run frequently to Temple Meads - Bristols central station. The property comfortably sleeps 4/8 with 4 double bedrooms and has  private off-road parking as well as a private garden.  Residential area so no noise.

column7: Stylish Family House near City Centre - Bristol
column8: Our house is located in a quiet residential area close to Bristol city centre and train station. Our friendly neighbourhood has local restaurants and shops and is located on a hill above the city, with stunning views across the city from parks and surrounding streets. The house is a big, bright, sunny space with large garden and outdoor seating. It is great family home, with 3 bedrooms two bathrooms and two reception rooms.  It is a great base for exploring Bristol and the surrounding area.
column9: Knowle is in South Bristol a couple of miles from the city centre,.  It has great transport links and is a 25 min walk to the centre.  The neighbourhood is a quiet local area, with good restaurants and bars.

column7: Beautiful spacious cottage with hot tub.
column8:
Gorgeous large three bedroom cottage on a small working farm inside Bristol. Private gardens and hot tub. Offering the best of city and country life.
Amazing location just a £10 uber ride into the centre of Bristol.
Uniquely positioned with fantastic and easy driving into Bristol as well as stunning views of the city from the farmland.
Looking to Ashton Court and the suspension Bridge. Fab for balloon fiesta.
Excellent position to Bristol airport as well as Ashton Gate stadium.
column9:
Yew Tree Farm is the very last traditional working farm in Bristol. Originally it was part of the Smythe estate from Ashton Court and was a diary farm until the 1950's. We keep a small herd of cattle, pigs and chickens in a sustainable and eco friendly way.
We love living here, it is quiet, charming and peaceful.

column7: Spacious sunny 3 bedroom flat in Bishopston
column8:
Newly refurbished, spacious self contained 3 bedroom apartment in a quiet semi-rural setting. The apartment is in a sunny Victorian house overlooking the old monastery fruit gardens. It has 3 spacious double bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen with dining table, living room & bathroom.
5 mins walk to the shops and restaurants of the vibrant Gloucester Road. Easy parking and frequent bus connections to the City Centre.
Close to Southmead Hospital British Aerospace/ Filton and Bristol University
column9:
Bishopston is a safe and quiet leafy neighbourhood, yet close to the City Centre.
While the Gloucester Road, known to be the longest independent shopping street in Europe with its buzzing cafes independent shops, music venues and pubs, is on your doorstop.
All amenities are easily accessible.
column16: Im a self employed commercial artist,  and love living in this wonderfully diverse and creative city.

column7: 3 bed Victorian house with private parking
column8:
Large 3 bedroom victorian property with lovely views. There is private parking on the drive at the front of the house.

Situated in a lovely residential area at the end of a quiet street there is a park (Perretts Park) just two minutes walk away with breathtaking views of Bristol. Just five minutes away there are local shops including a small supermarket, cafes, and a deli.

The property is very central and just 15 minutes walk from Temple Meads train station.
column9: The property is located in Knowle just adjacent to Perretts Park. It is a quiet residential and family friendly area with lots of green space for a city and excellent local amenities at the end of the road on the Wells Road. This is also where there are bus stops to take you either into central Bristol and to Clifton, or you can catch a bus the other way to Wells and Glastonbury which are both worth a visit if you have time.  Within 10 minutes walk from the house there are a selection of bars, cafes and restaurants if you don't want to venture into the centre of Bristol.
column16: Love travelling, the outdoors, cycling, and running. Have lived in Bristol (fab city) for over 15 years with my husband, Roger, and 2 boys, Dan and Ollie, born in 2008 and 2010.

column7: Creative & comfy home with parking and garden
column8:
A creative and comfy home in South Bristol with large fireplace and wood burning stove plus a beautiful, lush, walled garden and pond.

Our home is fully equipped with everything you need for a relaxing stay in Bristol and is just a 30 mins walk through two parks to the bustling harbourside and city centre or 20 mins to vibrant North Street with restaurants, bars, shops, theatres and cafes.
column9:
Our house is on a quiet street right next door to a park and community garden with a berry maze.

Supermarkets, high street shopping, restaurants and pubs are within easy walking distance.

Beautiful countryside, woodland and beaches are a short drive away.
column16:
My partner Pete and I love travelling and can often be found adventuring with our young son and little dog in the camper van.

Pete is a photographer and sculptor, among other creative things, and I work in cinema exhibition supporting film festivals and independent cinema.

We are both passionate about animals, doing our best to look after the planet and  being open and kind to others.

column7: Penthouse flat, 2 floors, impressive views
column8: Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located apartment. Spacious and quiet, yet near to Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road for restaurants, bars and independent shops. This apartment offers a convenient place to explore Bristol city, harbour and iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge.
column16: A keen ecologist, teacher, videographer and adventurer. Our home in St Andrews is a retreat for us - quiet and spacious, combining modern technology (WIFI, Smart TV, central heating) with our love of retro furniture and art. The back of the flat overlooks our garden and Bristol city (as I'm atop a hill) and is extremely tranquil. Yet out the front we can leave our front door and be in central Bristol in under 10 minutes. There are plenty of local bars, award winning restaurants, deli's, and cafes here. Stokes Croft and its vibrant night life, or Gloucester Road ( longest independent high street in Europe) are less than a 10 minute walk. As a new Mum I can also attest to the many great spaces and places for babies and young children in Bristol. If you are planning a family trip message me and I can fill you in. Hope you enjoy Bristol whilst you are here as much as we do :D

column9:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions, such as Clifton Suspension Bridge and Bristol Zoo Gardens, Clifton is one of Bristol's most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters. Beginning with the Clifton Triangle and reaching into the area affectionately known as Clifton Village, this stunning Georgian area is always hugely popular with visitors.

The thriving hub of Clifton Village features pretty streets lined with boutiques and fine places to eat. For an unusual shopping experience, the Victorian Clifton Arcade houses some of the most unique shops in the city, selling everything from vintage jewellery to home interiors. Watch the Discover Clifton Village film here. There's also a great map to help you navigate, which you can download here, or pick up a copy from the Tourist Information Centre.

column7: Large family home in the heart of Bristol
column8: Come and stay in our gorgeous, spacious Victorian family home with very large garden and driveway for two cars. Two reception rooms, large patio area and a comfortable farmhouse style kitchen mean lots of space for everyone to relax. Within easy walking distance of the independent Gloucester Road shops, bars and restaurants; beautiful St Andrews Park; the shops of Cabot Circus and the fabulous harbour. We love our house and if you want to discover Bristol we think you will too!
column9: Our home is in the area known as St Andrews, after the lovely Victorian park of the same name that is in the heart of the neighbourhood. Just 200 metres walk away you will find yourself on the Gloucester Road with its eclectic mix of independent shops, cafes, bars and boutique second hand clothing stores.
column16: I love travelling, which is how I ended up on AirBNB! Hotels never truly give you the flavour of a place; staying in a real home in a residential area is much more likely to shed a light on how it feels to live and work somewhere, with all its quirks and qualities. Recently we realised we wanted to share this experience with others by renting out our home too, in the incredible city of Bristol. No matter where we go, this fabulous place is home.

column7: Clifton Georgian Balcony Apt - Simplycheckin
column8:
Fabulous Balcony Apartment on Royal York Crescent
Location! Stay in an iconic Clifton Georgian on Bristol’s finest street with open balcony and views across the Docks and the West Country. This renovated 2-bedroom flat is right in Clifton village among the best restaurants, cafes and pubs in Bristol and an easy 15 minute walk from the City Centre. Perfect for business travellers, couples or small families visiting the universities or local private schools.
column9: Clifton (BS8) is Bristol's most affluent and arguably most picturesque area. Grand Georgian townhouses line the streets, a mixture of boutiques, indie shops, buzzing bars and leafy green open spaces.  Home to the famous Clifton Suspension Bridge, Avon Gorge and Bristol Zoo. Whilst being a fantastic base, you are also close to cultural centres such as the Watershed, the Arnolfini and Bristol Museum and University. This is mixed with more restaurants in the Harbourside and City Centre. Bristol has endless sightseeing opportunities.

column7: Sandbed House - Sleeps 4 to 6.
column8:
Location is very close to the city centre, for tourism, shopping and business.

Tourism; easy walking, harbourside, boats, restaurants and museums for both professional and recreational use.

Cabot Circus is only 15 minutes walk, Stokes Croft 20 minutes walk, home of multi-cultural restaurants, pubs, galleries and graffiti.

Parking is Free.
column9:
St Werburgh's is a thriving community with a high street that reflects the Bristolian spirit with its tasteful murals, cafes, breweries, and popular park. The house is just steps away from the local community centre which houses the cosy Neck of the Woods Cafe. Here, you can get excellent tea and coffee with good food (including cake)!

Tesco Extra is just a 15 minute walk or 6 minute drive away.

For the adventurous, two popular and well known climbing centres are within a 5 minute walk of the house.

column7: higgihaus 3a 4 Bed Big Groups Hip Location
column8: Stylish house that accommodates groups of up to 12. Located in Stokes Croft, the city’s most ‘hip and happening’ neighbourhood!
column9: The higgihaus@cheltenhamlane (#3a) sits in a hidden no-through lane and is a mere stone's throw from the Cheltenham and Gloucester Roads. Both are chock full of shops, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, pubs, supermarkets and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Montpelier). Stokes Croft (famed for its street art) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the independent traders on the Gloucester Road (known locally as Bristol's Indie Shopping District) a couple of minutes in the other.
column16:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

column7: Victorian family house off Gloucester Rd, sleeps 5
column8:
Entire house, sleeping comprises kids bedroom with 2 single beds and 2 bedrooms with double bed.
Victorian terraced house, recently renovated, with a good size back garden, big and bright kitchen with peninsula and dining area, spacious living room with fire place and big windows.
Ideal for families or small groups.
column9:
The street is a beautiful tree lined short street just outside Gloucester Road. The Horfiled Leisure Centre with swimming pool and gym is at walking distance. Supermarkets, pharmacy and pubs are also very close by.
A short car/bus journey will take you to Clifton and the city centre.
Our house is in a relatively quiet street, we have lovely neighbours and it's important to us that our guests are respectful of their peace and quiet.
column16:

I love design, food and travelling, but most of all getting to know different people and cultures. I also enjoy spending time outdoors with my family.

column7: Award Winning - Hidden Gem in Central Bristol
column8: WINNER of three RIBA Awards 2021 & ranked second out of eleven best Airbnb's in Bristol by Time Out magazine, a jewel hidden behind an Edwardian wall. The Corten Steel exterior peeps over the corner of one of the city's friendliest little streets lined with quirky cafes, award winning restaurants, and a delightful butcher & baker. Two double bedrooms, a lounge sofabed & a private roof garden overlooking the Mina Road park - the house has been finished and equipped to the highest standards.
column9: St Werburghs is Bristol's best kept secret, a charming spread of Edwardian streets with Mina Road, as it's 'high street'.  Award winning restaurants, cafes and lovely little local shops.  2 min drive from huge supermarket. 15 minute walk to Cabot Circus shopping centre. 25 minutes from the airport.  The area is brightened by the graffiti so beloved in Bristol (home of Banksy).    The curved exterior backs onto Mina Park with where children can play in a lovely playground.  Meet the locals out with their dogs and children.

column7: Period town house, prime Clifton Village location
column8:
Our 4 bedroom period townhouse could not be better located in Clifton Village.

It includes two large bright bedrooms with double beds, a single daybed in a third bedroom and a fourth room with a bunk bed.

Moments from the spectacular Clifton Suspension Bridge at the end of the street, it is within walking distance of award winning cafes, restaurants and boutique shops.
column9:
The house is located in the heart of Clifton Village, the must-visit location of Bristol and the South West of England.
Clifton is the home of Isambard Kingdom Brunels spectacular Suspension Bridge - not to be missed !! Following the terraces, crescents and squares of Georgian and Regency architecture you are led temptingly from Clifton Triangle to Clifton Village along a trail of award winning cafes, bars, restaurants, pubs, shops, chic boutiques and leafy squares.
Boredom will never set in as you share a postcode with some of Bristol’s most famed attractions – Bristol City Museum and Art Gallery, Bristol Observatory and the sprawling green Durdham Downs (great for walks, runs, or picnics if you’re feeling more relaxed).
Key shopping roads include Whiteladies Road, Princess Victoria Street and Regent Street.
column16: We are a family of five, Richard and Rebecca, and our three children George, Lottie and Teddy... Although we may be traveling in any combination of the above, depending on our trip.

Located in one of the best areas of Bristol with so many things to see and do right on your doorstep, this spacious 3 bedroom apartment is a fantastic base from which to enjoy all that Bristol has to offer.

Whether you want to enjoy the many and varied local cafes, bars or quality restaurants, explore Clifton Village or shop til you drop in Cabots Circus, your stay here will allow you to do it all.

column7: Large, Luxury City Centre Flat with Balcony
column8: This newly refurbished apartment is situated on the first floor of this typical Georgian townhouse.  You access the flat via a communal hall and stairs, shared with the other flats in the building and there are 2 flights of stairs to the first floor.
column9: Park Street is a vibrant part of our city with plenty going on at night.  The flat is perfectly placed for those visiting the city to watch a show or attend a gig as it's walking distance to The Hippodrome, Colston Hall, O2 Arena, St George's Hall and many of the smaller venues.    The bedrooms are situated at the back of the property so you won't be troubled by noise during the night.
column16:
Hi I'm Lavinia 

I've lived in Bristol for nearly 25 years and I absolutely love living here! I spent my childhood growing up in the Far East so I've done my fair share of travelling, but I still have a hunger for more! I manage a number of properties for family and friends and I love welcoming new visitors. I know the city like the back of my hand so I'd love to tell you about all the things that go on in our vibrant city. I look forward to welcoming you and making your stay one to remember.

 See you soon Lavinia

column7: Victorian Townhouse for Family Holiday
column8:
This is our lovely 3 storey Victorian semi-detached townhouse. Super close to all amenities, 500m to a country estate and 10 mins to the main motorways or 10 mins to Parkway Rail Station.
Great house for kids with plenty of indoor toys in our play room and plenty of outdoor toys in the large back garden.
Large kitchen diner and separate lounge with TV.
Off street parking for 1 car and plenty of free on street parking.
Easy to explore central Bristol which is 4.5 miles away.
column16: A horticulturalist who is also a DIY enthusiast (case of having to, not wanting to). LOVES baking cakes and LOVES eating cake more. Well travelled, reasonably well educated and LOVES laughing.

column7: Spacious Family Home, garden & driveway-up to 9ppl
column8:
A spacious three bedroom family friendly house in a great location with a garden and driveway for easy parking. Perfect for a family holiday.

This is our family home. It's situated between Gloucester Road and Kellaway Avenue so it's easy to get to and it has good transportation links. It also means you can easily enjoy all that Gloucester road has to offer from independent shops to delicious food.
column9: Horfield is a great neighbourhood. Gloucester Road has a lot to offer with plenty of places to eat as well as shop. It's also very simple to get to the centre of Bristol by bus, bike or car. We are also very near two parks and about a 20 minute walk from Badocks Woods!
column16:
I've been using airbnb for many years as a guest and in 2020 I branched out as a host. I'm originally from Brazil and have lived in many places and still love visiting new places!

My family and I live in Bristol and we love this city. There is so much to offer. We love the idea of other families using our home to enjoy this fabulous city. Please don't hesitate to contact me with any questions.

column8:
Beautiful townhouse in the city centre - comes with 2 double & 1 single bed plus two full bathrooms and a separate WC downstairs - sleeps up to 5.

Tastefully furnished throughout and with all modern amenities inc. dishwasher and coffee maker - proper ground coffee also provided.
The apartment comes with free secure parking on site for one car and a courtyard garden at the back.

Perfect for both families and business travelers.
column9:
Our 3 bed townhouse is located just off the historical Portland Square in an amazing central location. You can walk to Cabot Circus within just a few minutes!

The Townhouse is placed minutes from Cabot Circus, close to St Pauls and Stokes Croft, as well as an amazing stay if you are needing to get to the pub!

column7: Light and stylish 3 bedroom family home
column8: Tucked back from Fishponds Road, our 3 bedroom family home has plenty of space for up to 6 guests. The house is light, comfortable and stylish. We have a toddler and a 6 year old so there are plenty of toys and all the equipment you should need if you're bringing yours (including a travel cot). We have a drive that can fit one car, and another car can park across the drive if necessary. There is also free on street parking.
column9: Set back from Fishponds road, the area is quiet and has lots of families living in the area. We're a short walk from the beautiful Frome Valley where you can walk alongside the river either towards the city or out towards Snuff Mills and beyond.
column16:
I live with my husband Sam, our baby, Nancy and little staffie-cross, Nina. Having travelled all over the world, we're yet to find a place we love as much as Bristol. We feel incredibly lucky to live in our house in such an exciting, vibrant city. We want to share a slice of this and return some of the warm generosity we've experienced throughout our travels. 

I work as a family therapist in training and Sam is a children's social worker. We believe in social justice and equality and we are interested in what is going on in the world. 

In our free time we love walking through the countryside and gorgeous parks that practically back onto our house. We also enjoy spending time with family, cooking and hosting, travel, and making the most of what Bristol has to offer.

column7: Contemporary Home in Friendly Easton, Free Parking
column8:
We've just finished renovating our lovely home in Easton and would be delighted to host you while you explore Bristol.

With excellent transport links, both business and leisure travellers alike will be perfectly placed to get around. We have everything you could need to have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. Our house is handily located in a rare free parking zone!
column9: Excellent transport links, both business and leisure travellers alike will be perfectly placed to get around
column16: We feel our place is an ideal base from which to explore this fabulous city. It’s a short hop to the city centre (ask for a three-stop hop on any local bus and you’ll be in Cabot Circus in no time). We have free on-street parking right outside our door, so you don’t have to worry about pay and display or the parking permits which now place restrictions on motorists in many other parts of the city. If you don’t have a car, that’s no problem, as there is a regular bus into town that stops on our street, or you can take the train from Stapleton Road station and be at Temple Meads or Clifton in no time. If you like a good walk, you can get to Broadmead in around 40 minutes by following the Bristol and Bath Railway Path into town. However, if you want to feel like a real Bristolian, the preferred way to get about Britain’s first ‘cycling city’ is by bike, of course. Our house is handily located next to the Bristol and Bath Railway Path, so why not bring your bikes? The ride to Bath through the Avon Valley is stunningI am a Bristolian born and raised; my wife and I met here at university. Bristol really is a beautiful city. We love taking walks around the Floating Harbour, ensuring we take time to stop for coffee at the Olive Shed, a swift half at the Nova Scotia Hotel, or maybe even a delicious bite to eat at the containers on Wapping Wharf. We also enjoy taking in the stunning views from the top of Brandon Hill before checking out the quirky, artsy shops on Park Street. We always like to look in at the Boston Tea Party on Park Street, where the ‘secret garden’ provides perfect respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. We’ve owned our house in Easton since July 2019. Recently voted one of the top 50 coolest neighbourhoods in the world by TimeOut Magazine (September 2019), Easton really does have something for everyone. You will find trendy cafés selling excellent coffee and home-made cakes, world-beating curry restaurants, and plenty of friendly local boozers. We like to visit the gorgeous Este Kitchen for coffee and brunch. Just opposite, the Greenbank pub is a great spot for lunch or an evening pint or two; their guest ales change all the time and they have a decent selection of board games. If you’re planning a quiet night in, G Bros Pizza will do you a perfectly baked pizza. The M’Sala Library truly is one of the best curries I’ve ever eaten; be sure to ask for the vegetable samosas which are to die for. For the discerning foodie, the famous Bristol Sweet Mart on St Mark’s Road is a five-minute walk away. There you’ll find ingredients for sale from all four corners of the globe. Worth a trip, even just for a browse. We look forward to hosting you soon in beautiful BS5. Chris, Justine and baby Louis.

column7: Beautiful House off Gloucester Rd
column8:
We would be delighted to share our home with you! We love it here and have children and grandchildren in Bristol and the surrounding area. The house is a beautiful Victorian townhouse.

Bristol is a vibrant city with so much to do and loads of amazing shops, pubs, cafes and restaurants. The location of the house is very convenient and there is lots to do within walking distance. If you wish to go further afield, public transport and taxis are easily accessible.
column9:
Head north of the centre to find great nightlife, independent traders and a bohemian vibe on Gloucester Road and Stokes Croft. Take a stroll around bohemian Stokes Croft, often referred to as Bristol's cultural quarter. Discover unusual shops, great pubs, real clubs, fabulous food and a wealth of artist studios and ever-changing exhibitions.
In fact the whole area resembles an outdoor gallery with colourful graffiti that continually transforms its walls and buildings. You might see some great artwork today – but by the time you want to show it to your friends tomorrow it has miraculously vanished or changed into a completely new picture. Keep your eyes open for some of Banksy's best known pieces, such as the famous Mild, Mild, West, which is next to The Canteen and also look out for the giant mural Breakdancing Jesus by Cosmo Sarson on the opposite wall.

Gloucester Road is credited as the longest street of independent shops in Europe.
Independent shops and busine

column7: Modern 2-bed in the stylish Paintworks
column8: As the name suggests, Paintworks is a fun, colourful area of flats and work spaces - and this apartment is exactly that. There are 2 bedrooms, one with a workspace, the other with an en-suite bathroom, both with king beds. There's also a second bathroom and an open-plan kitchen and living/dining room with a double sofa bed. The flat is stylishly furnished and comes with a designated parking space. Bristol city centre is less than a 10-minute drive away.
column9:
Arnos Vale borders Totterdown which was named the fifth hippest place to live in the UK by The Times in 2016. The area is most famously known for its brightly painted Victorian houses, many of which are situated on a large hillside and can be seen from miles around. They resemble the colourful and vibrant feel of Totterdown itself and are a symbol of Bristol.

The Paintworks complex itself is an artistic hub of flats and work spaces for independent artists, creative, digital and wellbeing businesses, based right on the River Avon. There are several green spaces and parks close by as well as a great bar and two restaurants on site. Temple Meads Station is a 15-minute walk and it’s less than 10-minutes to drive to the city centre. Sainsbury’s and M&S supermarkets are a 10-15 minute walk-away.
column16:
Although I was born in London I've lived all over the UK and have been lucky to be able to visit lots of the world for both work and leisure. I also lived in France for a while so am fairly fluent in French.

I settled in Bristol 12 years ago and love it here - there is always so much happening and it's a super friendly & fun city.

The flat has only recently been listed on Airbnb but it's been my home for 2 years so it's perfect for longer stays with a properly equipped kitchen and lots of home comforts. There are shops and a large supermarket within walking distance.

My home and business are both in Paintworks - Bristol's creative quarter - which means I'm close by if you need any help or have any problems. If there's anything I can do to assist during your stay I'm only a phonecall away.

column7: Spacious Victorian home on the Gloucester Road
column8: Live like a true Bristolian in an original Victorian home on Gloucester Road, one of Bristol's best loved streets. The light and airy spacious home is split over three levels and packed with original Victorian architecture. The house also has a lovely sun soaked rear garden for alfreso dining. The property benefits from off street parking, transport links second to none and shops, restaurants and pubs quite literally on your doorstep.
column9: Gloucester Road has an abundance of independently ran coffee shops, cafes, restaurants, bars and shops. The neighborhood is extremely special and unique. The Independent once described Gloucester Road as the Last Great British High Street. It is a trendy and bohemian area with a very relaxed vibe.
column16:
Hi, my name's Sophie, and I am very lucky to be living in the wonderful city of Bristol.

I work in publishing, and am a lover of all things travel, cooking, and can usually be found with my nose in a good book.

I love hosting people from all over the world with my partner Calum and our boys, Dylan and Sonny.

column7: Grade II Listed Converted Church Tower - 6 person
column8: Welcome to our historic tower in central Bristol where you will feel perfectly at home and experience the city as a local, in style.
column9:
Step out of Cabot Circus, cross the main road (Temple Way) and through the old Victorian park, and you will land in the heart of one of the most historic areas of the city. This was the first part of the city to be built around the castle and today is a thriving bohemian shopping quarter in Bristol.

Old Market Quarter is home to a great selection of shops from vintage fashion and antique shops, independent furniture stores to specialist climbing and motorcycle stores. As you peruse the shops on street level, be sure to look up at the array of architectural designs of the buildings.

This area is known for its LGBT-friendly shops, pubs, bars and clubs.

If you're looking for a traditional pub to stop for a drink or bite to eat then hunt out The Phoenix, which has a great far east inspired menu as well as pub classics.
column16: I'm a keen traveler, loving city trips as much as country breaks. Put me in a kayak or treat me to oysters fresh from a local catch and I'll be very happy!

column7: Amazing Victorian House overlooking the docks
column8: Beautiful, arty, four bedroomed  Victorian family house. The house backs onto the historical docks and has the river Avon at the front. situated in the city centre on Spike Island. Stunning views, all mod cons, only a few mins walk from Wapping Wharf and the city centre. Free wifi, 1Gbps & parking for two cars. This is an amazing space for a getaway with family and friends. We have been super hosts on Airbnb for years, offering rooms in our house. We are now offering the whole house.
column9: We're in the centre of Bristol, overlooking the River Avon to the front and the Harbourside / Docks to the rear where Bristol's heritage steam railway takes visitors along the docks railway. There is a museum, water taxis and many more daily attractions to amuse all ages. Wapping Warf and its many cafes, bars & restaurants is only 200 meters from us. This is foodie heaven with around 20 converted shipping containers, selling gourmet foods, one owned by a Michelin starred chef, another by a BBC Masterchef finalist with another section offering fine wines to Yoga, Jewellery to Tapas, an organic butchers, Cheese and ice cream purveyors and Mexican, Korean and Japanese eateries.
column16: I was a TV Director, now I am writing my first novel, play guitar with several bands, narrate audiobooks. My partner Jacqui, works for a charity, teaches and is a crafter; we’re Both creatives, love good food, music and the cinema but not necessarily all at the same time. Our religious views are that you can see Bristol Cathedral from our back garden.

column7: Family home with extraordinary garden
column8:
This is our family home in a quiet residential neighbourhood, within easy reach to other parts of Bristol on foot, bike, or car, with an enormous back garden that makes this place extra special.

It's a detached 1930s house over 3 floors, being ground floor living area, first floor bedrooms and family bathroom, and attic room with own shower room.

The back garden stretches to 70m, with a childrens' play area. It's an oasis in a busy city, filled with birdsong and wildlife.
column9:
We live in a quiet family-friendly residential neighbourhood.

We are less than 5 minutes' walk from a lovely park with a children's playground, tennis club, bowls club and church.
About 10 minutes' walk in any direction there are lots of shops, supermarkets, cafes, restaurants, pubs, including Gloucester Road's famous independent shops, Coldharbour Road, Henleaze Road, Whiteladies Road.
It's about 20 minutes' walk to the Downs and Bristol Zoo.
It's 8 minutes drive to Clifton, the suspension bridge, harbourside, city farm, and other tourist attractions.
column16: We are a family of five living in Bristol UK. We make our own home available to guests and when we travel we like to stay in homes rather than hotels.

With easy access to Temple Meads train station and the M32. An ideal location to see the best of everything Bristol has to offer!

You will find some great places to eat within walking distance such as Grano, Bakehouse, Old Market Assembly, Bagelicious, Chido Wey and more

column9:
Redcliffe, England, United Kingdom
The City Centre and Old City of Bristol are the heart of the city and offer a superb taste of culture, food, history and fantastic shopping opportunities. A trip to Bristol would not be complete without a visit to its central area.

There's a lot crammed into one space including Central Bristol and the Bristol Hippodrome, Bristol Shopping Quarter, Bristol's Old City and Bristol Old Vic, Park Street and College Green and Christmas Steps Arts Quarter. Making this an area to explore to its fullest on your visit.
column16:

column7: Bristol Bubble: 3 bedrooms on vibrant street
column8: The bubble is the second floor of a townhouse with 3 bedrooms  and a shared shower room. The bright twin bedded room with fridge kettle and microwave overlooks Gloucester road with many shops pubs and cafes. The two smaller double bedded  rooms with a view over gardens are quieter. The the bubble gives you exclusive use of all three rooms and the shower room, together  accommodating from 1 to 6 guests. A 4poster bedroom (ensuite) on the floor below may also be available to book- just ask.
column9:
Gloucester Road is a great street with many independent shops restaurants and cafes. 5 mins walk to park or county cricket and frequent buses to the centre and beyond. Stokes Croft is nearby with even more food and music.

This is the best part of Bristol.... it is rich with independent unusual and creative businesses of every sort. There is live music in several venues most nights, and great food inspired by the world, and by localism and seasonality. The shops are quirky, with fabulous gifts (some made locally) as well as essentials. Gloucester Road morphs into Stokes Croft- the artistic and creative hub of North Bristol- on its way to the centre with the river, and the SS Great Britain.
Bristol is a good base for touring about...it is near Bath, and not too far from Stonehenge and Longleat or the seaside at Weston Super Mare or Clevedon. It is also a good stopping off point if on a long journey from North to Southwest or from west Wales to the South East.
St
column16: My name is Prue, a keen cook who likes crosswords, Scrabble, paintings and red wine in any order. I love Bristol. It is friendly and quirky and interesting. After more than 10 years here, I realise I will never get it properly, as it is so many things to different people.... I am a few minutes' walk from the Gloucestershire County Ground (cricket, Neville Road) in the middle of a long road of mostly independent shops, galleries, cafes, restaurants and pubs. Who could ask for more?

column7: Hidden Gem with the best views in Central Bristol
column8:
Welcome to the Orange Factory. A historical three storey town house based a literal stones throw from the Bristol Royal Infirmary and Children’s Hospital.

In walking distance from the best Bristol has to offer, from the notorious bars, restaurants and architecture of Clifton to the metropolitan Diversity of Bristol that is rapidly becoming one of Europe’s most popular City break destinations.
column9:
The location of the Orange factory really does offer it all.

It is incredibly close to the Children’s Hospital and BRI, offers a five minute walk to Central Bristol and a ten minute Walk into Clifton.

Theatres are very close by with the ‘Bristol Beacon’ (formerly the Colston Hall) and the Bristol Hippodrome just two minutes down the road.

It doesn’t matter if you are doing the Banksy trail, living it up in Clifton or getting in some well needed retail therapy in the Cabot Circus
shopping centre. Getting around is more fun and easier than ever with the introduction of the Vio electric scooter network that is now freely available in Bristol.

The property is a very short walk from the bus station, Trenchard Street NCP and a cab ride from Bristol Templemeads station

column7: higgihaus 3b 4 Bed Small Groups Hip
column8: Stylish house that is set up for spacious accommodation for up to 8. Located in Stokes Croft, the city’s most ‘hip and happening’ neighbourhood!
column9: The higgihaus@cheltenhamlane (#3b) sits in a hidden no-through lane and is a mere stone's throw from the Cheltenham and Gloucester Roads. Both are chock full of shops, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, pubs, supermarkets and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Montpelier). Stokes Croft (famed for its street-art) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the independent traders on the Gloucester Road (known locally as Bristol's Indie Shopping District) a couple of minutes in the other.
column16:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

column9:
The house is in a leafy suburb and still only 10 minutes from the city.

It's really a hidden gem, we are in the city but with the privacy of a private house at the end of a cul de sac that isn't overlooked.

The famous Bristol Downs is a 5 minute walk and you are just 5 minutes away from a choice of bus routes.

column7: Harbourside heaven
column8:
Mark and Corinne welcome you to Cumberland Road in Bristol’s historic harbour area.

This four bedroom semi detached Victorian house is on Spike Island, with the harbour to one side and the river the other.

The house is on four floors with big rooms and high ceilings. The garden looks over the harbour and also features a cabin with a double sofa bed.

Here you are just a few minutes’ walk from Bristol’s trendiest new quarter, Wapping Wharf - with two of the city’s highest rated restaurants.
column9:
This is the coolest place in the whole of Bristol. Ok so we are biased, but others think so too! The waterside vibe, the profusion of great places to eat and drink, the lack of roads to the rear and the location (very central) makes it unique.


Our recommendations for arts and culture:

- Arnolfini. A landmark arts centre and a beautiful spot on the harbour.

- Watershed. Just on the opposite quay, great for film.

- Bristol Museum. Usually has a good exhibition on but also has a great collection, particularly Victorian painters.

- Bristol Old Vic. Worth a visit as such a historic theatre and now looks fabulous after major refurb.

- Tobacco Factory. Very cool place, some good productions. Also on North Street, home to Upfest and some of the best graffiti in the country.

- M Shed. Tells the story of Bristol wonderfully.

- Banksy. Stuff everywhere, some iconic. There’s one by Bristol Marina near
column16: Mark works for a conservation charity, Corinne is a sitting tribunal member and a criminologist at UWE.

Featuring high ceilings, a charming courtyard area with seating, a large dining table and living room. With 2 large double beds and a king size sofa-bed it sleeps up to 6 people.

Situated in Clifton Village, with it’s boutique shops and independent restaurants, it’s only a 20 minute walk to the SS Great Britain, Cabot Tower, Park Street and the City Centre.
column9: Clifton Village is the heart of Bristol full of artisan shops, stylish delis and independent bakeries. There are also many delicious places to dine out including The Ivy Clifton Brasserie, Fishers is a wonderful independent fish restaurant, The White Lion Bar in the Avon Gorge Hotel overlooks the suspension bridge and The Clifton Albion which does 5 Star Award winning Roasts on a Sunday.

column7: Great  located Victorian house with all amenities
column8: This delightful, handsome bay fronted Victorian end terraced four bedroom house is situated in the centre of Shirehampton's Village only 40 metres from the large Co-op super store located directly on the high street and the variety of other shops and food outlets also located in the village centre. Bus stops are also located within 40 metres of the property and Shirehampton railway station is only 0.5 of a mile away, and only around four miles from the centre of Bristol .
column9:
Plenty of green parkland, a bustling High Street, village pubs, a church, a greengrocer and only around four miles from the centre of Bristol. Is it really possible to live on the edge of the city and yet still feel part of a genuine village community.
The next thing any local worth his or her salt will tell you is that it is not actually Shirehampton, but ‘the Shire’. The name, of course, speaks volumes: this is no ordinary district of Bristol, but a closely-knit community immensely proud of its traditional, village-like feel.
Tucked away in the far northwest corner of the city, the Shire sits on the edge of the River Avon, close to Avonmouth Docks and separated from the rest of Bristol by the beautiful Blaise Castle Estate. The location presented early residents of the Shire with something of a headache – until the completion of the Avonmouth Bridge in 1974, the only way of getting across the River Avon to neighbouring Somerset was in a small row ferry that ran between a l

column7: Spacious 4 bed family home with garden in Bristol
column8: Our four bedroom home, with a huge open-plan kitchen opening on to the garden, is in East Bristol.  What we love about our house is that you are surrounded by green space and big skies but also close to the heart of Bristol and can easily access the South-West. From here you can walk in beautiful nature and to the independent cafes/shops of Easton and Fishponds. You are only two miles from the city centre - on bike via a cycle path or by bus or car, which you can park for free outside the house.
column9: This is a friendly, safe and green neighbourhood. Eastville park is at the end of our road and it has a kids play-area, basketball and tennis courts. There are four supermarkets close by or you can go independent and get everything from fresh coffee, Indian treats and Turkish flatbreads on St Mark's Road, in Easton or head to Fishponds village.

column7: Beautiful family home with garden in Bishopston
column8:
Our house is a beautifully restored Victorian terrace house in the desirable Bishopston area of Bristol, just off Gloucester Road. The house includes a comfortable living room, a play room, and a modern and extended kitchen with double french doors leading to the patio and garden. Upstairs there are two double bedrooms and a children's room with a toddler bed. A cot can also be provided.
There are many cafes, bars, restaurants and shops within a few minutes walk away.

column7: Beautiful large, comfortable Bristol family home
column8:
Gorgeous Victorian townhouse in sought after area (Bishopston): 2 mins stroll from the Cricket Ground; 3 minute walk from funky cafes & eclectic shops on Gloucester Road (UK’s longest street of independent shops). The City is 20 minutes walk or a short bus ride.

Spacious and full of plants, books and paintings, our comfortable home has a large kitchen/diner and sunny living room. We have a small but flowery garden.
column9: Bishopston is a creative, friendly, safe neighbourhood which centers around Gloucester Road which is an incredibly popular Bristol road packed with independent shops, cafes, eating places, galleries etc. It often has street events and food stalls and draws people in from miles around. We are very lucky to live a few minutes walk from Gloucester Road, but as we are two streets back from it, our street is quiet and calm.
column16: Hello, we're Suzi and Stu and we have lived in Bristol for about 25 years. It's difficult to imagine wanting to leave as Bristol is such an exciting, creative and friendly city with loads of green spaces and stunning countryside all around. With our two children, and one dog, we make good use of everything that Bristol has to offer including great bars, restaurants, galleries and all kinds of quirky and independent shops, pop-ups and theatres.

column7: Peaceful two-bed home near station, child-friendly
column8:
A real home from home. A light-filled 2-bed Victorian on a quiet cul-de-sac street, 15 mins to the waterfront and trains. Normally my home where I write and edit books, rented out while I travel.

A few meters from Victoria Park, it has a beautiful garden surrounded by trees. Large bedrooms, open plan kitchen and sunroom with spacious work area.
column9:
Windmill Hill is a tiny island in the middle of the city, a grid of streets on one side and Victoria Park on the other. I love it because it's so central, but feels like a village.

There is a brilliant coffee van in the park only a minute away, and a convenience store down the hill, with bigger supermarkets and loads of great charity stores only 5 minutes away on East Street.

Vibrant North Street is 10 mins away and Whapping Wharf with its bars and cafes 10 mins in the other direction. There are local yoga studios, gyms and cafes I can advise you on.
column16: I am a writer and editor working from home in Bristol

column7: Chic Clifton Home – inviting décor & outdoor space
column8:
Welcome to our stunning bolt-hole in a fabulous East Clifton location, just off the Whiteladies Road.

Our home offers a spacious living/dining room space with wall to wall patio doors, leading to an enclosed garden. The sleek kitchen is well-equipped for dining in, and our king sized, double and single bedrooms all boast characterful vaulted ceilings!
column9: The location could not be more convenient, situated just off Whiteladies Road - which boasts an abundance of independent shops, supermarkets, restaurants, cafe's and bars. It is just moments walk to into central Clifton - one of Bristol's most popular and highly regarded spots, and from there you are only minutes away from Bristol Harbourside and City Centre.

column7: Beautiful 2 bedroom Garden flat with own parking
column8: A stylish and bright garden flat located in leafy Clifton.  Only a minutes walk from the hub of the Whiteladies Road yet a stroll to the peaceful, open spaces of Clifton Downs and the iconic Clifton Village.  On site private parking, two spacious bedrooms, a large and well presented living room with a pullout Hypnos sofa bed, two bathrooms and a private patio for morning coffee make for a memorable stay at Alexandra Gate.

Come and enjoy a home from home in the heart of Southville (BS3). This beautiful home, decorated with attention to detail, showcases beautiful artwork from Bristol and beyond.

Southville is a bustling place, with cafes, bars, and restaurants. The house is a short walk to the centre (15 min) along the docks, with ready access to the countryside (10 min walk to Ashton Court).

The house is fully equipped (linen, towels, kitchenware) to allow you to enjoy your break, stress free.

column7: BEAUTIFUL 3 bedroom house in the centre of Bristol
column8:
Beautiful town house in an amazing location. 5 min walk to Wapping Wharf where you'll find the harbour, brilliant bars and restaurants, lovely shops. The centre is basically right there.
The other way, North Street is 5-10 minute walk and has lots independent bars and pubs and all of the famous Bristol graffiti murals.

column8: 5 bedroom house with off street parking sleeping up to 12 guests in Bristol
column16:
Hi all, we hope you enjoy browsing our properties.  We have a wide range of short term serviced accommodation and holiday lets perfect for holidays and corporate business trips. We have property of all levels so I'm sure we can find something to suit your requirements and your budget. Even if you don't see it listed, we still may be able to help you with local properties. 

As well has holiday homes, we also have properties suitable for medium to long term letting ideal for contractors and corporate clients.  For any stays longer than 6 weeks, please contact us for our specialist rates. 

If you are planning a special occasion, please let us know any additional requirements you would like with your stay.  If we are not able to get it, our team will certainly try! 

Please contact us and we'd be happy to help you with your questions.    We would love to chat to you about your serviced accommodation and holiday home requirements so please get in touch.  

Pillow Partners

column7: The Old Dutch - Clifton
column8:
This immaculate garden flat in Clifton has an industrial vibe in the living area with a Banksy mural in the hall, still keeping a very cosy
feel to the space. The garden is private and self contained.

The flat is 150m from Whiteladies road, packed with bars and restaurants to explore, with an M&S foodhall right on the corner.
The Lido is 4 mins away if you wanted a bracing swim or delicious brunch to start your day.
column9:

Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

column7: Light and spacious eco-home in unique community
column8: Featured in Grand Designs, this eco-community is just a mile from the city centre but surrounded by green and quiet space. It’s a 3 bed family home, not a show house, so it’s warm, comfortable, quirky and very well equipped. The open plan living-dining-kitchen area is stylish, cosy and great for get togethers. You have your own private garden with patio, and parking for one vehicle. We’re 20 mins from the city, and close to great eating places, pubs, independent shops, and amazing street art.
column9:
This is a unique and quirky neighbourhood. It began as a self-build eco-project, and has grown into a strong and supportive community which cares passionately about our community and environment. We are a mile from the city centre, but surrounded by green spaces - a nature reserve, allotment gardens and the City Farm (kids love petting and feeding the animals) with the excellent Farm cafe and playground. We have Mina Park and playground, a great butcher/baker (Popti & Beast), fab Italian cafe (Napolita), organic grocers (Chaya Veggies), and Better Foods organic supermarket nearby. There are several excellent pubs within 5 mins walk - The Farm has a great garden and live music, the Duke of York is a famous fave. The Climbing Academy and Bloc indoor climbing centres are nearby.

The area has a very relaxed and alternative feel, with lots of fabulous street art which constantly changes, and because we are so centrally located many great Bristol locations are just a walk away -
column16: Hi, I'm a young retiree, I love travelling, alone or with my partner, meeting people, having new experiences. I enjoy staying in friendly places and shared homes, so I love Airbnb, both as a guest and hosting others in my own home. column8:
Get to know the real Bristol in our newly renovated townhouse, just off St Marks Road, one of the most sought after roads to live in the UK. A stones throw from the bustling & tasty Garden of Easton and the renowned East Bristol Bakery, with the best cinnamon swirl going!

column9: Very family orientated with community feel.  Very nice quiet street with friendly locals
column16:
Looking for new exciting things in Bristol but like to call the mountains home.

With its abundance of cafes, bars and restaurants, there are plenty of places to relax and watch the world go by and something to suit every taste and budget. column7: Charming Bedminster Home - Sleeps 8
column8:
This 4-bedroom house is in the residential area of Bedminster in South Bristol, just a 10-minute drive from the city centre.
Sleeping up to 8 guests in 4 bedrooms it is the perfect space to spend time with colleagues, family and friends, an ideal home from home.

We kindly ask for no loud stag and hen groups and also no loud parties to be mindful of the neighbours please.
column9:
The house is in a prime location for exploring Bristol and its surrounding areas, just a 10-minute drive from the hustle and bustle of the city centre and all of the must see attractions.

North Street is a 15-minute walk from the house, known to be a mini Stokes Croft, it has of lots bars and restaurants as well as cool independent shops and cafes. It is also where Upfest takes place, one of Europe’s largest street art festivals, where you will find the works of many talented artists displayed across the buildings.

A 20-minute walk from the house you will find Ashton Gate Stadium, home to Bristol City FC and Bristol Bears Rugby, the venue also holds concerts during the summer.

The house is located opposite Parson Street train station allowing guests to easily hop on a train to many of the surrounding areas, it is also on a direct bus route into the city centre.

column7: Stylish 3-bedroom family home with large garden
column8:
Welcome to our spacious and stylish residential home located in beautiful Victoria Park close to Bedminster, Wapping Wharf and Bristol City Centre.

- 3 spacious bedrooms to comfortably accommodate 6 guests
- Fully fitted open plan kitchen and dining area with all appliances
- Bi-fold doors that opens up into a large private garden with outdoor fire pit, bbq and furniture to enjoy all day sunshine
- Walking distance to Bristol's best spots - a perfect house for families, friends and travellers
column9:
The stylish family home is situated in a very friendly neighbourhood of Victoria Park in South Bristol. It is a residential area of Bristol, so there are lots of welcoming families and young professionals. The best part of the house is the location. It is situated about 100m from Victoria Park, one of the biggest and best parks of Bristol. This is perfect for anyone wanting a daily walk, run or to relax in the sunshine over the weekend.

There are local corner shops, plus an amazing bakery about 3-5 minutes walk from the house, plus 2 amazing pubs (The Victoria Park Pub and The Star & Dove) within 5-10 minutes walk. There are also larger shops including Tesco Express, Asda, Lidl all within 5-10 minutes drive away from the house.

Victoria Park is beautiful and a perfect spot to watch the sunset over Bristol. It is also walking distance from Southville, Bedminster, Wapping Wharf & Harbourside and Bristol city centre.

column7: Arty House with Garden in Central Bristol
column8:
This 3-bedroom Victorian house is full of character, with original period features and tasteful art. Large bay windows at the front of the house and skylights at the rear bring natural light in, and the space is complimented with plenty of houseplants and warm lamps - perfect for cozy evenings around the dining table or in front of the smart tv.

Situated at the end of a cul-de-sac, this house has no passing traffic, and benefits from free on-street parking right outside the front door.
column9:
Easton is a very culturally diverse area, 1 mile to the east of Bristol city centre - recently voted one of the top 50 “coolest neighborhoods” in the whole world!

Although the house is in a very quiet cul-de-sac, the area in general can feel a little crowded and intimidating if you are not used to it - but it’s actually a very safe and friendly community.

There are plenty of shops & pubs nearby, including a small supermarket at the end of the street. A half-mile journey to the south will bring you to Church road, where you will find larger supermarkets and some great restaurants and bakeries. A half-mile to the North will bring you to St.Marks rd, which boasts unique cuisine from around the world.

column8:
We’re all about good times and a friendly atmosphere. Whatever the occasion, we have an incredible space for you.

​Hiring us exclusively means you would have sole use of our entire warehouse sleeping up to 16, all bedrooms are ensuite. There is a large communal area with Pool and Table tennis table. This area also has a large table with bench seating and dining chairs. Fully equipped kitchen with oven, hob, dishwasher, sink & fridge freezer.
column9: Coalshed is located in Southville, Bristol. It’s an area of rich coal mine history and backs onto Dame Emily Park, which is a local skatepark with tons of green space, play area, community garden and ball courts   Bristol was named as the best place to live in the UK in a guide by the Sunday Times and Southville is regarded as one of the most sought after areas within it.  Independent cafes, restaurants and shops fill North Street, which is a few moments stroll away from Coalshed.   Each Year Southville hosts a number of events, including UpFest, Europe’s largest Street Art and Graffiti Festival, Bedminster Winter Lantern Parade and North Street Summer and Christmas Fairs.  Coalshed is about a 10-15minute walk away from the City Centre, Harbourside, Southville life has everything you could wish for..

column7: Arty, light & colourful house with valley view!
column8:
Relax with the whole family in this creative, peaceful and comfortable house in East Bristol. The house fronts on to the Bristol to Bath cycle path making it easy to reach the city centre in 10 - 15 minutes on two wheels. The back of the house looks over a valley of allotments giving the house a country feel close to the City.

The house is full of interesting objects and art. There is a wood stove for cosy evenings and a terrace with a view to sit with a glass of wine and watch the sun go down.
column9: We are in a green oasis within the city. Flanked on one side by the cycle path and on the other by the valley of allotments. It is a friendly family area with a strong community. There are beautiful walks down into the valley as well as the secret viaduct leading to Greenbank Cemetery. Eastville Park is a stones throw away and offers a river, Woodland and open park space as well as great facilities for children.
column16: I am an actor and puppeteer with an interest in all things creative and the natural world. I enjoy walking, yoga, food, the arts and health. I live with my partner who is a maker of all kinds of amazing things and our 2 small children.

column7: St Paul's Suites - Apartment 4
column8:
A spacious 2 bedroom flat just a short walk from Bristol City Centre and located in the heart of a thriving community with independent shops, cafe's and bistros.

Bristol's cultural hub, Stoke's Croft, is just a 10 minute walk away and the trendy Mina road a 5 min walk in the opposite direction.

The apartment itself is part of a local brand new development and can sleep up to 6 guests comfortably. The apartment is 1 of 4 so please enquire if you wish to bring a larger group.
column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi

It sits between Park Street and Brandon Hill which has fabulous views of the historic Bristol harbour.
column9: Set back on a quiet street, parallel to Park Street which has plenty of late opening bars and night clubs and is a very short walk to the docks and centre of the city.  Our street is suprisingly quiet given it's location!
column16:
Hi I'm Lavinia 

I've lived in Bristol for nearly 25 years and I absolutely love living here! I spent my childhood growing up in the Far East so I've done my fair share of travelling, but I still have a hunger for more! I manage a number of properties for family and friends and I love welcoming new visitors. I know the city like the back of my hand so I'd love to tell you about all the things that go on in our vibrant city. I look forward to welcoming you and making your stay one to remember.

 See you soon Lavinia

column7: Light and Colourful Three Bedroom Semi
column8:
Our unique and family friendly house is beautifully decorated and fully equipped.

Located in Windmill Hill, with the beautiful Victoria Park close by and plenty of good pubs and restaurants on the vibrant North street nearby.

Great transport links make it ideal for exploring Bristol and surrounding area. Parking on drive.

Enclosed rear garden is a beautiful space to enjoy sunny evenings eating and entertaining.

Upstairs workspace.

It is our home and we look forward to welcoming you.
column9:
Local Pubs and Restaurants

20 minute walk away from trendy North Street with lots of excellent bars, restaurants, coffe shops, etc. Nearest good pub is The Victoria Park Tavern (5 mins away). The Rising Sun (up on Windmill Hill) is also a nice pub.

25 minute walk to the south side of Bristol docks and the Cargo containers at Whapping Wharf which is packed full of excellent independent bars, shops and restaurants.

Transport Links

Bus stop outside house with frequent buses into city centre. Bristol Temple Meads train station 5 minutes by car/taxi or 20 minute walk. Bedminster station 10 minute walk (30 minutes from here to Weston-Super-Mare and then on to beautiful Devon).

Nearest Shops

Local shop/newsagent/post office 5 minute walk away on St Johns Lane. Bakery 5 minutes walk away. Local Tesco Metro 15 minute walk away in Totterdown. Nearest Supermarket (Lidl) 15 minute walk away.

Nearest high street 20 minute

column7: Edwardian Bristol home
column8:
This house blends tradition with modern living. A large open plan living space with many Edwardian features, new kitchen and bathrooms. It has a beautiful terrace and garden from which you can enjoy the last of the suns rays as it sets over the garden and hills beyond.
The location enjoys the best of both worlds: Bristol city centre is an easy 15min bus journey, but there is the River Frome valley and Snuff Mills on your doorstep as well as Eastville Park Playground. Enjoy!
column9:
Thingwall Park is a leafy street of Edwardian houses, in an oasis of calm from the city. Our house backs onto allotments and then the Frome valley, so it doesnt feel like being in the city. There are several footpaths that lead directly down to the river. From it is easy off-road walking or cycling to Snuff Mills, Oldbury Court and Purdown. Eastville Park is a 5 minute walk away at the end of Thingwall Park. Our closest children's playground is here.
Bristol is a charismatic city offering lots of its own food and culture to explore.
From the house, within easy walking distance is the Star pub, Gorilla Thai take-away, and supermarkets.
There are plenty of buses into Bristol City Centre with a bus stop 2 minutes from the house on Fishponds road. The journey to the harbourside and cathedral takes 15-20 minutes.
column16: Both myself and Kathryn are secondary school science teachers! In summer we take off with our 2 boys all together for an adventure. We rent out our home on Airbnb to guests whilst we are away, we hope you like it as much as we do!

column7: Redland Suites - Apartment 1
column8:
This spacious 3-bedroom high spec apartment sleeps 8 guests comfortably.

A gorgeous fully equipped kitchen and 3 luxury bathrooms complete with waterfall showers and freestanding bath are some of the stand out features.

All of the high-end furniture has been selected with your comfort in mind and you have exclusive access to a beautiful courtyard garden as well as 2 off street car parking spaces.
A stones throw from the ever popular Whiteladies road, this unique property ticks every box
column9:
Tucked in a quiet side street just off the bustling Whiteladies road this apartment is perfectly set for relaxing and exploring.

Whiteladies road is home to an array of bars and restaurants such as:
The Spiny Lobster
Pizza Workshop
Bosco Pizzeria
Clifton Thai
Alter ego
Pasta loco
Bravas
Kings arms To name a few

Clifton downs are just a short walk up whiteladies road where you can take scenic walks and attend a variety of organised festivals and events throughout the year.
A short walk down Whiteladies road and you will come to The Clifton Triangle. Here there are many more shops bars and restaurants as well as Bristol University and Bristol Royal infirmary, from here you can walk down Bristol's most famous street - Park street and take in the views of the centre and the Christmas lights if you're lucky enough to be visiting in December!
The bottom of park street leads you to Bristol's iconic waterfront area.
