column8:
Welcome to our spacious, comfortable and quiet 5 bedroom family home in Bristol. Off street parking, lovely garden and games room with climbing wall, pool table. Outdoor seating, BBQ and trampoline.

Walking distance from Durdham Downs (1km), Clifton (1km) and Gloucester Road (0.5km) providing a range of shops, restaurants and many of Bristol's famous green spaces and landmarks.

A great base for access to Bristol's centre and the many attractions nearby in Bath, Somerset, Cotswolds and beyond.
column9:
Located in Bishopston, a leafy residential area close to Bristol City Centre. Walking distance to Westbury Park (restaurants, cinema, delicatessens, shops and Waitrose supermarket) and Gloucester Road (alternative shops and great restaurants and pubs). Beautiful Clifton village with its boutique shops and restaurants close by.

The house is also walking distance from Durdham Downs with views to Brunel's suspension bridge, Avon Gorge and out to the Bristol Channel.

Bristol City centre with shops, galleries, museums and nightlife is a short drive, bus or taxi ride away.

Mendip Hills and the Cotswolds within 45 minutes as well as lots of beautiful countryside locations for walks.

Regional attractions Bath City Centre, Bristol Zoo, Wild Place, Longleat, The Wave (surfing lake), Cheddar Gorge, Wookey Hole and Chepstow Castle all within 1 hour drive time.

column7: Bohemian & Spacious, Beautiful Garden + Balcony
column8: Welcome to our unique semi-detached Bristol townhouse. We are nestled in the heart of Montpelier, within walking distance to loads of independent shops, cafes and restaurants. Our house spans four floors - with one superking bedroom,  two double and two single bedrooms (one with bunk beds), three reception rooms and three bathrooms. We moved here 10 years ago and renovated the house from top to bottom trying to retain as many original features as we could while bringing it into the 21st century!
column9:
Montpelier is an area just north of Bristol’s city centre that is well known for its bohemian vibe. It is a wonderful area to visit in Bristol, and it has its own distinct feel with its beautiful terraced houses, many of which are painted in pastel colours.
There is loads to see and do in Montpelier. One of the first things you’ll notice is the street art. The Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is one of the most well-known murals in Bristol.
Much of the best things about Montpelier can be found on the busy, bustling Picton Street. Here you’ll find a fine array of independent shops and restaurants, as well as an excellent family-run Italian delicatessen. Enjoy coffee and cake at The Bristolian, go for dinner at Thali Restaurant or Bianchi's!

column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi

column9:
Brislington is a vibrant and historic district located in the south eastern suburbs of Bristol, England. The area is known for its unique blend of modern amenities and historical charm, and there are plenty of interesting things to discover and explore.

One of the most iconic landmarks in Brislington is the Arnos Vale Cemetery, a sprawling Victorian-era cemetery that is home to many notable figures from Bristol's history. The cemetery is a popular destination for walkers and nature lovers, and it is also a hub for cultural events and community activities.

For those interested in history, the Brislington Conservation Area is home to a wealth of architectural treasures, including the Grade II-listed St. Luke's Church. The area is also home to several other historic buildings, including the purportedly haunted Arno's Manor Hotel.

Brislington is also home to The Paintworks, a former industrial site that has been transformed into a creative hub, is particul
column16: A wife, mother of two and the CEO of a wee digital agency and tech social enterprise here in Bristol which I run with my husband Stuart. We don't get out much  - the business is all-consuming so we're really looking for some decent short breaks to make up for it :).

column16: Hello! Originally from Canada, I work with service apartments and accommodation in the UK. column7: Enchanting Cottage with Cosy Attic Hideaway
column8:
Welcome to our little cottage located in the popular area of Bedminster, Bristol!
This is a lovingly restored plant filled home- away-from -home found at the end of a quiet little lane.
Whatever your reason for visiting Bristol, if you want a quiet place to retreat to afterwards, surrounded by nature, then this is the place for you.
Chilled vibes only please. Sit and enjoy the bird song in the garden. This is a very tranquil spot close to all that Bristol has to offer but without the noise.
column9: The cottage is located in popular Bedminster down ,just 10 minutes drive to the centre of Bristol! Equally the gorgeous areas of countryside that surround Bristol are very easy to access by car from our house, and Bristol airport is only a 10 minute car/taxi ride away.
column16:
Hi! We are Emma & Daniel, and we are hosting our lovely little cottage for the summer whilst we are staying near by. 
We are Bristol locals and our house is located in beautiful Bedminster down, just on the outskirts of the city, a short drive away from all of the popular Bristol spots. We hope that you enjoy our home and feel free to message us with any questions you may have!

column8:
Our three bedroom home in Totterdown is located by Perrett's Park with amazing views over the city. Three large double rooms, two full bathrooms garden with patio and lawn, large open plan kitchen/dinner and separate living room. Our top floor loft conversion boasts a balcony with stunning views.

Totterdown is a vibrant community which is easy walking distance to the centre, Whapping Wharf, Temple Meads train station with bars, cafes, supermarket, street art and several green spaces all close.
column9: Totterdown is a vibrant and central area of Bristol with great access to the city centre and parks. Perrett's Park, Victoria Park and Arnos Vale Cemetry are all a short walk from the house. There's good transport links and shops/cafes within a few minutes walk from the house.

column9: Coalshed is located in Southville, Bristol. It’s an area of rich coal mine history and backs onto Dame Emily Park, which is a local skatepark with tons of green space, play area, community garden and ball courts    Bristol was named as the best place to live in the UK in a guide by the Sunday Times and Southville is regarded as one of the most sought after areas within it.   Independent cafes, restaurants and shops fill North Street, which is a few moments stroll away from Coalshed.    Each Year Southville hosts a number of events, including UpFest, Europe’s largest Street Art and Graffiti Festival, Bedminster Winter Lantern Parade and North Street Summer and Christmas Fairs.   Coalshed is about a 10-15minute walk away from the City Centre, Harbourside, Southville life has everything you could wish for..

column7: Bright & Spacious Family Townhouse - with Garden
column8:
Perfect for families or small groups looking for somewhere light and spacious to stay in Bristol. A homely space with plenty of character and charm.

The house is situated in the peaceful neighbourhood of St Anne's, which is only 2 miles from the city centre and Bristol TM station. It is surrounded by greenery, with St Anne's Woods opposite and the back gate leading out to the St Annes Park. The local pub is around the corner and serves delicious food + craft ale.
column9:
St Anne's is a lovely, quiet village-like neighbourhood not far from Bristol City Centre. There are plenty of green spaces around, including St Anne's Park, St Anne's Woods, Nightingale Valley and the footpath running either side of the River Avon.

There is a great local pub, the Langton, and a decent sized Coop supermarket 10 minutes walk down the hill or an even larger Sainsbury's supermarket 5 min drive.

St Annes has an Anglican church with regular Sunday services.

"St Annes House" is a nearby community arts space and frequently hosts art exhibitions and events, run by the arts organisation Bricks.

column9:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant
column16: Prescott Apartments main aim is to provide travellers with the "home away from home" feeling they require. We take pride in our apartments and strive to constantly increase levels of guest satisfaction. Whether you're relocating to the city, after a quick get away or even working in the area. We aim to make your stay quick, easy and enjoyable.

column7: Health and Art in Comfort
column8: The place is well situated Maisonette close to the University and within short walking distance of most attractions such as the Suspension Bridge, The  Downs, Clifton Village, Park Street and the Bristol Harbour. Although Tudor House is located in a quiet neighbourhood in leafy Redland, just around the corner on Whiteladie's Road is great nightlife with restaurants, bars and pubs. The  immediate environment is friendly and quiet with small shops and local pubs but the city centre is close by.
column9: Redland (actually Tudor house is on the border of Redland with Cotham) together with Clifton are probably the nicest parts of Bristol to live in. With its tree lined streets, parks and large Victorian and Georgian houses it has a wonderful character. However it still is close to all the amenities you may need and sights you will want to see whilst visiting. Just around the corner from the flat on Whiteladies Road are number of friendly restaurants, such as the ,The Townhouse ,the Cowshed  or great Thai restaurant, with genuine Thai food. There are many more restaurants and pubs just around the corner on Cotham Hill, with covered outdoor seating, but the immediate environment of the flat is quiet and homely. My particular favourites are the Highbury Vaults pub on St Michael's Hill, just up the Cotham Hill and to the right, The Lido restaurant close by in Clifton off Oakfield Road.  Clifton Down Shopping Centre is withing 5 minutes walking distance with a Sainsbury's supermarket, Pharmac
column16: I love Art, travel, good food,people and my work as a designer architect... For my leisure I keep fit swimming and gymming, I love sailing, skiing when I can find the time and try to enjoy life as much as possible in hopefully healthy way. When travelling I prefer to do it not as a tourist but try to imagine what it is like to live in the place... I have lived in Prague, London, Hong Kong, Dubai and for the past 12 years in Shanghai... and travelled extensively in Europe, US, Middle East, Asia and SE Asia. I have stayed in apartments through Airbnb  and have had a great experience of the city this way. My permanent home is Bristol, the city I always love to return to from my travels.

column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi

column7: Peaceful & Zen Family Home In The Heart Of Easton!
column8:
Welcome to our 3x bedroom family home situated in the multicultural and vibrant community of Easton!

Our home is nestled into a beautiful family friendly cul-de-sac, with ample parking on our doorstep. Situated just behind St Marks Rd, which is buzzing with some of Bristol's finest independent coffee shops, cafes, bakeries, restaurants & gastro pubs!

Easton is renowned for its distinctive character and community spirit, and our home acts as a gorgeous family base by which you can explore it!
column9:
Easton is renowned for its distinctive character and community spirit, and boasts a host of local amenities, attractions and community events that draw many visitors from outside the area.

Situated just off St Marks Road are Bristol Sweet Mart, Thali Café, East Bristol Bakery, and The Garden of Easton. Also close by are No 12 Café, The Greenbank pub, Este Kitchen, Matter Wholefoods, and Public Market.

The area offers a beautiful wealth of green spaces including the Greenbank Cemetery, the parks at Eastville and St George, and riverside walks along the nearby Frome Valley, and just minutes from the house is the locally cherished Bristol to Bath Cycle Path, ideal for commuting quickly into the city centre or just for weekend strolls, long runs or bike rides.

Easton truly is the throbbing heartbeat of multicultural Bristol!

Located within 10 minutes of The Wild Place Project, and with in 15 minutes of The Downs, the historic Clifton Suspension Bridge, the SS Great Britain plus hundreds of bars and restaurants.

The Mall at Cribbs Causeway is a large indoor shopping centre, along with a leisure complex with multi-screen Vue cinema, ten-pin bowling and a large number of restaurants for you to enjoy & is a 10 minute drive away from the house.

There are live play theatres in Bristol , like the Bristol Hippodrome and the Bristol Old Vic where you can enjoy a show of your choice after a fabulous local pre-show dinner.

Bus stops are no more than a 5 minute walk away with routes that can take you to Broadmead where you can find plenty of shops and entertainment.

column7: A Family Home Alongside St Andrew's Park
column8:
Come and experience life in St Andrew's. We're minutes from the fabulous Park and within walking (or a bus trip) distance to the harbour and Clifton.

Our house dates from 1890 and we've been restoring it to its former glory. We hope that you enjoy the original features (like the many fireplaces!).

We are a family of four (with a two and four year old) and this is our home. That means the space is well set up for visiting families with items like highchairs, cots, and many toys to play with.
column9: St Andrew's is North of the city centre and is next to the bustling Gloucester Road (lot's of lovely eating spots and independent stores). The neighbourhood mainly consists of large Victorian villas and there is a fantastic park as a focal point. We are at the playground and splash pad all the time.
column16: I love to be out and about in the countryside, visiting cities with pretty architecture, and enjoying the fun of being in a new place. My job takes me travelling all over the world (I'm an economist and work in the foreign aid sector) but rarely to holiday destinations. When I'm travelling for pleasure I like good food, being outside, and winding old streets.

column7: Garden Flat with Garage for one car
column8:
Spacious three-bedroom apartment with private access to patio and garden, and free off-street parking for two cars.

Arguably the best location in Bristol! You're right on the border of the cultural quarter and the leafy posh bit and can access either within a few minutes' walk, depending on your preferences / mood.

Ideal for families, groups of friends (but no parties please) and for couples - or even singles - who like to have a LOT of space.
column9:
Within a 300m radius there are three great independent pubs. Down the hill in Stokes Croft, you have a wide selection of restaurants and cafes, including excellent Korean, Sri Lankan, Jamaican, Cuban and even British (nearby Pie Minister is in my opinion as good as it gets!). Plenty of vegan options too.

If you like street art, this is your Mecca. The earliest works of Banksy are all nearby and there's one really small one nobody knows about just round the corner. If you don't like street art, no problem, just walk in the opposite direction and head for Redland and Clifton, where you'll find prisitine sandstone walls, boutique shops, more excellent food and drink options, an incredibly comfortable and luxurious cinema experience at the Everyman, and the splendour of Clifton Downs.

It's all easily walkable from here, as is Cabot Circus, the main shopping district.

column7: Fantastic 4 bedroom apartment with parking
column8: Situated on the prestigious Whiteladies Road, Clifton, Bristol-a newly refurbished luxury apartment, fully furnished, you will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located place. Great restaurants, cafes, takeaways and many attractions on your doorstep, also lovely walks close by on the famous Durdham Downs, Iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge and Avon Gorge. Bristol City Centre with its associated theatres is a short distance away, conveniently situated to Bristol University.
column9: The most Beautiful and affluent area in Bristol with fabulous attractions, lovely independent shops, museums, interesting pubs, and eateries all on your doorstep.

column7: 3 Bedroom Penthouse in Bristol
column8:
A unique 3-bedroom penthouse apartment in St. George, Bristol, situated on the top floor of a converted chapel.

The open-plan kitchen, living and dining area has high ceilings with exposed wooden beams. There is a spacious mezzanine work area, three double bedrooms and two modern bathrooms, each with a shower and one with a free-standing bath.

The apartment is a short walk from St George's park and the amenities of Church Road, with easy access to Bristol City Centre.
column9: Easy walking distance from popular bars and cafes, spacious St. George's park and the award winning Trooper's Hill nature reserve, with it's breathtaking views over Bristol and the River Avon.  Bristol City Centre is just a few miles away, with good public transport and road links.

I have lived locally for my whole life, and it's been wonderful to be a part of our blossoming community. The property is furnished with everything you’ll need for a trip with family or friends.
column9: Our home is located on friendly Sandy Park Road, with a bakery, deli, pub and convenience store just down the road! You can easily take the number 1 bus to  pop into the city centre and enjoy all the fantastic attractions, shops and nightlife which Bristol has to offer.
column16: Hi, I'm Jamie! Welcome to my flat. I have lived here locally my whole life and have seen Southville blossom into one of the most desired areas in Bristol. I’ll be letting my home while I take some time to explore Europe and then the rest of the world (hence the feature wall). I would love for you to enjoy my home and explore some of the many charms located nearby, both on North Street and the amazing Wapping Wharf!

column7: Clifton Downs House
column8: Beautiful Victorian 3 double bedroom house in Westbury Park metres from Clifton Downs, a short walk from the shops bars and restaurants of Whiteladies Road and Clifton and a short trip to the city centre. The sought after 'Little French' restaurant featured on 'Remarkable places to eat' 50 yards around the corner. Everything you could need for a UK city break.
column9:
Westbury park is a quiet residential area with excellent amenities such as Little French, a lovely french brasserie featured on 'Remarkable places to eat' on the BBC. Little Shop, from the same owners as Little French, is a lovely cafe with the best sausage rolls on the plant. The Westbury Tavern, Cambridge Arms and Eastfield Inn are aa fantastic pubs for food and drinks, each with outside space, perfect for summer afternoons.

There is also a Waitrose, butchers, fishmongers and cheese shop only a two minute walk away.

column9:
Clifton, located in Bristol, UK, is a picturesque and affluent suburb known for its elegant Georgian architecture, vibrant atmosphere, and stunning views of the Avon Gorge. With its charming streets lined with Georgian and Victorian buildings, Clifton exudes a timeless elegance. The iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge, designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, spans the gorge and offers breathtaking vistas of the surrounding countryside.

The area boasts a lively cultural scene, with trendy cafes, boutique shops, and artisanal eateries scattered throughout. Visitors can explore attractions such as the Clifton Observatory and Caves, offering panoramic views from its rooftop terrace, or stroll through the scenic Clifton Downs and Clifton Village, known for its quaint squares and leafy green spaces.

Clifton is also home to the prestigious University of Bristol, adding a youthful energy to the area. Whether it's enjoying a leisurely walk along the Avon Gorge, admiring the arch
column16: Prescott Apartments main aim is to provide travellers with the "home away from home" feeling they require. We take pride in our apartments and strive to constantly increase levels of guest satisfaction. Whether you're relocating to the city, after a quick get away or even working in the area. We aim to make your stay quick, easy and enjoyable.

column7: Colourful Edwardian family home
column8: A beautiful Edwardian terraced home in a quiet street with a lovely garden and stunning views over the Frome Valley and into Bristol. Our cozy, colourful and well loved home is set in a quiet, leafy road in North East Bristol.  We are 20 minutes by bus from the city centre and close to extensive parkland with foot and cycle paths.
column9:
Our road overlooks the Frome Valley, which is North Bristol’s ‘green lung”. Beyond our garden about six acres of council allotments separate us from the River Frome, and a small lane about 200 metres from our front door leads down to the Frome valley walkway. This gives us access to several miles of paths that link Eastville Park (with its children’s playground), Snuff Mills river and woods, Oldbury Court Estate, Stoke Park Estate and Purdown. We regularly do a 2 hours circular walk from the house to Purdown and back that involves only a few hundred yards on roads, the rest being footpaths along the river through woods and fields and over hills.

There is plenty of wildlife to be seen in season. There are resident buzzards and sparrowhawks in the valley along with jays, jackdaws, crows, magpies and the inevitable seagulls. In summer we await the arrival of swifts and occasionally see a peregrine falcon flying over from the Avon Gorge on the other side of Bristol. Down b
column16: Hi there,  I am British and live in Bristol UK with my wife Matilde, who is Swiss-Italian but has lived here in UK since 1976, she speaks Italian and French as well as English.  We have two grown up children and three grand-daughters of 8, 6 and 5 who we are mad about.  We love to travel and here in Europe that usually means our 6 metre Adria camper van.   When the kids left home we had an adult gap year and travelled through Europe to Turkey then back to Morocco, Senegal and Gambia, crossing the Sahara desert twice in our old Mercedes camper.  Then a few of years ago we took the whole family to Southern India for a month which was amazing (I spent a year there in the 80's and hadn't been back since).  So anywhere new pushes all our buttons and we love to explore, meet new people, eat, drink, walk, cycle and generally enjoy what the world has to offer.  We also love music and play piano and accordion (Matilde) and guitar and banjo (me).  So there you are, we look forward to meeting you and enjoying your home and city, wherever it may be.  Now we are hosts too and if you book our lovely home we hope you enjoy staying here and exploring Bristol and the West of England.

Four-bedroom family home in the heart of Southville, a lovely neighbourhood in central Bristol. Ashton Court & Leigh Woods just a few minutes’ drive.

Large green garden, with outdoor table, fire pit, kids’ trampoline. Bright, spacious kitchen-diner with access to garden. Cosy living room. Utility room with washing & drying machines, large sink, downstairs toilet. Upstairs, four sizeable bedrooms, main bathroom and shower room. Plenty of toys (2 - 10 year olds). Facilities for remote working.
column9:
Our place is set in the heart of Southville, which is a lovely quite neighbourhood just over the river from central Bristol.
It's a short stroll from North Street, which is famous for its array of independent shops, including butcher, fishmonger, greengrocer, and many cafes, pubs and bars. It's also just a short walk to the Bristol's Harbourside. Once a busy dock where sailors and merchants would trade goods and set sail for voyages of discovery, Bristol's Harbourside is now a gorgeous area filled with cafes, bars and shops and waterside restaurants. You can sit and let the world pass you by while watching the boats head in or swans swim past, while dangling your feet over the edge with a cold glass of cider in your hand. There are also sports and activities including yachting, paddle boarding, cycling and rowing on offer. Stroll around the water’s edge and you will find Millennium Square, with its fountains and big screen, as well as Brunel’s SS Great Britain, We The Curious, Br

column7: 4 Bed Family Home in Bristol
column8:
Wonderful home in Bristol in the heart of leafy Bishopston just a stone's throw away from the shops, restaurants and pubs of Gloucester Road.

Across the 4 bedrooms, you'll find everything you'd expect from a well-loved family home with boxes of lego & hairdryers.

Central Bristol is easily accessed either by a short bus ride, £8 taxi or 25-minute walk. We take great pride in our home and we hope you'll love it as much as we do.

No stag or hens. This is a family home suitable for families only.
column9:
Bishopston is just north of Bristol city centre which is easily accessed either by a short cab journey (around £6 - £8 for an Uber or Bolt) or by walking down the amazing Gloucester Road which has a wide variety of pubs, restaurants and independent shops as well as a co-op and sainsburys local round the corner.

Despite being so close to town, the area is very quiet and safe with the majority of neighbours being families including a popular primary school across the road.

Enjoy some of the best of local green space. Easy metrobus connection to the city centre makes this perfect also for those wanting to explore our vibrant city.

column9:
The house is in an amazing location with convenient access to central Bristol and walks to pubs, bars and restaurants.

Snuff Mills woodland with the river Frome running through it is a stone's throw away, as well as Stoke Park, which if you can muster the uphill walking strength, offers arguably the best view of Bristol!

UWE, the MOD at Abbeywood, Airbus and Rolls Royce are also very local, with Abbeywood being a 7 minute drive.

column9: We are perfectly situated in between Clifton Village - 4 mins up the hill and Harbourside - 4 mins down the hill. It's a quiet residential Georgian Crescent. column16:
Hi I'm Lavinia 

I've lived in Bristol for nearly 25 years and I absolutely love living here! column7: Kingsdown Little Gem Banksy's  Old Home
column8: Beautiful garden flat in the late Georgian, early Victorian area of Central Bristol. It is tastefully decorated with artwork and Persian rugs. Wood burning stove and all the basic amenities for a comfortable and enjoyable stay. I do not use perfumes and harsh chemicals to wash my bedding.
column9:
The flat is located very close to the centre of Bristol. Stokes Croft and Gloucester Rd are popular shopping, dining, and socializing areas. There is a history of street art in the area.
The location of my flat is in a quiet area called Kingsdown, but technically, the postal district is called Cotham. The housing in the area is late Georgian/ early Victorian townhouses, which are terraced housing, usually four floors.
The flat is close to Bristol City Centre. It is within walking distance of Bristol University, the Bristol Royal Infirmary, and a bus ride to Southmead Hospital. The Hippodrome, The Old Vic and Saint George's, which are all popular entertainment venues, are all within walking distance from the flat.
column16:
I am Norman,  and I  am your host. 
 I have lived in Bristol for 24 years.   I am easy going, I enjoy life, and I enjoy living in Bristol. I have a 13-year-old son and a beautiful family. The paintings on my walls are painted by my dad and the rugs are my mum`s gift to me. I love art, but my creativity has come through more in my music. Hope you enjoy my garden,  5 different varieties  of roses and when in season, the blooming is spectacular.

column9: Located right next to the attractive Bristol Harbourside, you will find an array of restaurants, bars & shops just a stone's throw away! column7: Duplex Apartment - Harbour View city centre.
column8:
Whether it’s a short getaway or working in Bristol’s central areas, this fully air conditioned apartment is perfectly located for everything Bristol has to offer.

Walking distance to all of the main attractions. Pay & Display parking is available on the main road outside of the property or in the car park opposite. As it’s a central city apartment the nearest free parking is 15 minutes walk away. Details provided in the house manual.
column9:
The apartment is just a short walk from the famous SS Great Britain and the M shed museum, making it ideally placed for exploring Bristols Maritime history.

There are also an array of bars and restaurants along the harbour serving everything from craft ales and pizzas to cocktails and fresh sea food. There’s something for everyone!

Head 10 minutes south of the harbour and you will find yourselves in Soutvhilles famous North street area where again you will find an eclectic mix of restaurants and bars. As well as Bristols premier sports venue - Ashton Gate stadium. Home of Bristol City and The Bristol Bears as well as big summer concerts.

Just a short walk North into Clifton and you will be able to explore high end shops and restaurants located in beautiful Georgian buildings as well as the iconic Clifton suspension bridge.

column7: Modern house with Upfest mural
column8: Modern end of terrace four bedroom house just off the popular North Street, featuring its own colourful Upfest mural on the side. This is a family home and very accommodating to young families.
column9:
Bedminster, our neighbourhood, is one of the most vibrant and exciting areas in Bristol, we feel so lucky to live here. The area benefits from having lots of independent shops, cafes, restaurants and pubs- we are spoiled for choice when going out for a coffee or a drink! Bristol is famous for its food scene and many of those award-winning restaurants are within a 5-minute walk of the house.

Another huge bonus is how easy it is to walk to Wapping Wharf, the harbour side and Bristol City centre- we tend to walk everywhere and never feel the need to get the bus.

We are also blessed with being surrounded by lots of great parks and with easy access to the countryside beyond.

column7: Spacious South Bristol Suburban Family Home
column8:
Welcome to our family home, in the suburbs of South Bristol. Ideally located for exploring Bristol and beyond, we are 10 minutes from the Airport by taxi, and a few minutes walk from the Airport bus route into central Bristol.

With plentiful green space nearby, and room for up to seven guests, we are fully equipped for families, with a playroom including indoor swing a large enclosed garden, with lots of outdoor toys and off street parking.
column9:
Our house is in the quiet leafy suburbs of South Bristol, and it's only a five minute walk to local nature reserves and public footpaths into the countryside. There's also a park, just around the corner with a playground and football pitches, plus regular transport links into central Bristol and to the Airport if needed.

The nearby green spaces offer panoramic views over Bristol towards Clifton Suspension Bridge, and Ashton Court Estate where the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta takes place during August. Ashton Gate stadium is also located nearby, offering sporting and musical events throughout the year.
column16:
Hi, I’m Carl, and alongside my wife, Ola, we like to share our home with others, when we’re not staying there ourselves.

When we’re away, we can still be contacted and we have professional support on hand, in the unlikely event there are any issues.

We will remove all of our personal belongings before the start of any reservation, and where possible, we can alter the layout of rooms to suit your needs - just ask and we’ll see what we can do.

Lawrence Weston is a neighbourhood in the northwest part of Bristol, UK.
It is situated approximately 5 miles away from the city centre.
Lawrence Weston is known for its residential character and green spaces.
Primarily a quiet residential area, it is ideal for those working in Avonmouth.

The distinct look of Lawrence Weston stems from its post-war construction using Laing easy-form materials. This area is gaining popularity due to its proximity to motorways, local industries, and excellent transport links. Residents benefit from various amenities, including shops, schools, and community centres that provide essential services and social activities.

Transportation is convenient, with regular bus services connecting Lawrence Weston to the city centre and surrounding areas. Major road networks are also easily accessible, allowing residents to explore all Bristol offers.

Overall, Lawrence Weston offers a warm and friendly neighbourhood

column9:
Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music

column8: Our lovely Edwardian, four bedroom home, lies on a quiet, friendly, residential street with a fantastic park, children’s playground, basketball and tennis courts at one end and the wonderful Frome Valley with river walks and wild flower meadows at the other.
column9:
Our lovely Edwardian, four bedroom home, lies on a safe, quiet, friendly, residential street with a fantastic park, children’s playground, basketball and tennis courts at one end and the wonderful Frome Valley with river walks and wild flower meadows at the other.

The views from the house towards Purdown are really something special and you can watch the sun set and forget that you are just 2 miles from the thriving centre of Bristol. We are a stone’s throw from the gorgeous Bristol to Bath cycle path- Bristol is a short 15-minute cycle, but there are also regular buses (48 and 49) into the city centre from the nearby bus stop. There is free parking on our road and of course you can get around Bristol by car but remember there is now a clean air zone in the centre.

East Bristol is a great area of the city. St Marks Road in Easton is a lovely street with independent cafes, restaurants and wholefood shops for you to enjoy like Sweetmart, Garden of Easton cafe, Eas

column7: Bristol House by Cliftonvalley Apartments
column8:
Make yourself comfortable at Bristol House whilst away for a work stay or holiday visit to the vibrant City of Bristol.  Room for you to relax, with 4 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, a lounge, kitchen dining area and a garden.

Towels and linen are provided and facilities include a fully equipped kitchen with kettle, toaster, microwave, range cooker with multi-ovens and hob, fridge/freezer, washing machine, cooking utensils, cutlery (silverware), crockery and glasses. Iron and Ironing Board.
column9:
There are shops like Spar and Tesco Express within walking distance plus a variety of takeaways also nearby. More shopping and restaurants at Abbeywood and at the Cribbs Causeway regional shopping and entertainment venue are also close. A bus ride or taxi down Gloucester Road gets you to many more restaurants, bars and the central parts of Bristol.

A great stay for those working in the area with businesses like Airbus, Rolls Royce, MOD, MBDA UK, BAE, GKN Aerospace, Aviva, SGS/ Filton College, University of the West of England (UWE) and many others less than 10 minutes away.

It’s a short 5 minute drive or 15 minute walk to Abbey Wood Retail Park, which contains a 24 hour Asda Superstore and a 24 hour McDonald’s. The Retail Park also includes restaurants like Bella Italia, Nandos, Frankie & Benny’s and Costa Coffee.

column7: Beautiful period family home
column8: Our spacious family home is the perfect base from which to explore Bristol and the surrounding area. There is a newly extended kitchen, a sunny front room and a separate family room with a 65 inch TV, as well as four large bedrooms, a lovely quiet garden and free on-street parking. The house is in a quiet neighbourhood with easy access to the M4 and M5, but is close to central Bristol and easy walking distance to the green oasis of Durdham Downs and the shops and restaurants of Redland.
column9:
Although we have neighbours close by, our street is very quiet with little traffic, and the area is peaceful and friendly.

Westbury Park is a fantastic location from which to explore the Bristol and the surrounding area. We are just five minutes walk from Durdham Downs, 400 acres of open green space perfect for walks, sports and picnics. A few minutes further on is Whiteladies Road, with a huge choice of shops and restaurants. A two minute walk in the other direction brings you to Waitrose, our nearest pub and a local cinema. Bus links into the centre of Bristol, for visits to the Docks, museums and Cabot Circus shopping centre, are also a short walk away.

column7: Spacious Townhouse & Garden w/ Panoramic Views
column8: Tucked away in leafy Montpelier, this characterful townhouse is full of surprises. Two stylish and spacious sitting rooms provide maximum comfort for lounging, whilst the impressive lower ground kitchen leads straight out into a Japanese-inspired garden. It doesn’t stop there - the top floor is an impressive open-plan master bedroom with incredible views out over the city. Walk to cosy local pubs, farm shops and some of the city’s best restaurants, or wander down to the harbourside and beyond.
column9:
This beautiful townhouse is tucked away on a quiet street in Montpelier, one of Bristol’s most-loved neighbourhoods. Known for its bohemian vibe, Montpelier feels like a village more than a city suburb. Find vibrant local pubs, incredible restaurants, artisan delis and cafes all a short walk away. Plus, you’re in the prime spot to enjoy all that this vibrant city has to offer, and best yet it’s all reachable by foot!

Stroll alongside the harbour, hopping in and out of art galleries, coffee shops and the renowned M Shed Museum. Or enjoy a bite to eat in the unique Wapping Wharf - this cultural quarter boasts eateries and independent shops all housed in refurbished shipping containers. In summer, there’s nothing better than sitting on the water’s edge and soaking up the lively vibe of this vibrant city.

With so many different neighbourhoods to explore, you can spend days exploring Bristol’s city centre. Wander through Stokes Croft to see colourful graffiti by Brist
column16:
We love welcoming new guests to stay with us. As keen travellers ourselves, we always take note of the things we love about our trips and try to bring those elements to our own spaces. Whether that's through little touches in the house or always being available should you need help or local advice.

After using Airbnb as a guest and host for many years, we decided to put our experience to good use and founded Guesthoo - Cornwall & Devon's first Airbnb management company. Now managing properties all over Cornwall, Devon & the South West, we are wholly committed to ensuring our guests have the best experience possible when staying with us. Search 'Guesthoo' online for more information.

column7: 3-Bed Townhouse in Bristol's Bohemian Heart
column8:
This ideally situated Georgian townhouse with three double bedrooms was once home to Archibald Leach (Cary Grant)!
It's a lively but surprisingly tranquil spot despite its centrality, and has a peaceful private garden for outdoor dining or relaxing at home.
Conveniently located to access all major parts of the city, whether you've come for music, theatre, museums, the amazing food and drink culture, city festivals, university, visiting relatives, or any number of other things Bristol offers.
column9:
Montpelier is one of the most vibrant parts of Bristol to stay in. There is incredible street art at every turn, and countless things to see, do, and listen to within a few steps from the front door, including a lovely array of local shops, eateries, bars and clubs along nearby Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road. It's close to much of the University of Bristol campus, and has several green spaces nearby despite being so close to the centre - my personal favourites being St Andrew's Park and Castle Park. The street can be lively, which can sometimes mean some noise, but for the most part is fairly tranquil. Local events like St Paul's Carnival and Picton Street Christmas Fayre are very nearby. There's a great music scene in Bristol, with something for every taste, and I'd say similar about the food culture!
Feel free to ask if you have questions about any of the above.
column16:
I'm easy-going and I like to keep it simple. I'm a musician, counsellor and CELTA (English) teacher by trade. I love music, nature, food and drink, games/sports/anything playful, and diving deep/connecting with people. 
I'm really passionate about Bristol, especially the food, music and history, and I try to fill my life (and those of people around me I hope!) with as much laughter, connection and creativity as possible.

column9:
Welcome to the vibrant neighbourhood surrounding Bruton House. This prime location offers a perfect blend of history, charm, and excitement, making it an ideal choice for your stay in Bristol. Let us guide you through the highlights of this remarkable neighbourhood:

Clifton Village:
Immerse yourself in the picturesque streets of Clifton Village, just a short stroll away. This historic neighbourhood is known for its Georgian architecture, quaint boutiques, and charming cafes. Explore the local shops, indulge in delicious treats, or simply soak up the village's unique atmosphere.

Clifton Suspension Bridge:
Don't miss the opportunity to visit the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge, a symbol of Bristol's engineering prowess. Take a leisurely walk across the bridge and marvel at the stunning panoramic views of the Avon Gorge and the cityscape below.

Bristol Zoo Gardens:
Nature enthusiasts will delight in a visit to Bristol Zoo Gardens, locate

column9:
Clifton ( literally 'Cliff town' as it is perched on the cliff overlooking the Avon Gorge), is one of the most beautiful and exciting areas of Bristol. The great Georgian terraces (our flat is in one of the oldest ones) and the fine wooded gardens make it one of the pleasantest areas to walk around. Clifton features the famous Birdcage Walk, the pleached lime walkway immortalised in Helen Dunmore's last novel, and the park in Victoria Square has countless different kinds of mature oak.
Clifton also has some of the most stylish shops and restaurants in Bristol. You are also just ten minutes walk from the city centre and the groovy Harbourside. The university is close by, so too are the main art galleries.

Enjoy the range of local independent boutiques, cafes, and restaurants nearby or take a short stroll (or a bus) into the city centre. column9:
Southville, located in the city of Bristol, is a vibrant and sought-after neighbourhood known for its unique character and strong sense of community. Situated just south of the city centre, Southville offers a blend of residential charm, cultural attractions, and convenient amenities.

The area is renowned for its rows of colourful Victorian terraced houses, which lend a distinctive and picturesque charm to the neighbourhood. Southville is a popular choice for families, professionals, and creatives alike, thanks to its proximity to the city centre and its thriving arts and music scene.

Southville is home to a diverse range of independent shops, boutiques, cafes, and restaurants. North Street, the main thoroughfare, is a bustling hub of activity, offering a wide array of dining options, trendy bars, and local businesses. The community's commitment to supporting local enterprises creates a vibrant and unique shopping and dining experience.

column9:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant

column7: Family Home with fabulous views
column8: Ours is a well-loved family home with four bedrooms and two living areas both with open fires. The spacious kitchen-diner opens onto a west-facing terrace leading to a mature garden which overlooks Purdown and the Frome Valley. Bristol City Centre is 2 miles away and accessed by regular buses (48 and 49) which stop on the main Fishponds Road. The Bristol to Bath cycle path is close by and you can get to the centre in 15 minutes.
column9: Ours is a quiet, residential street in an East Bristol neighbourhood. Fishponds itself offers a number of eateries, both independent and chain. There is also a selection of licenced premises close by, including the Star where you can hear see some great live music most nights. There is a range of popular supermarkets within walking distance of the house as well as plenty of independent stores selling produce from around the world. On St Marks Road in Easton, you can not only access the local train station, but you can also find a number of recommended restaurants and cafes and as well as the infamous Sweet Mart.

column8: Embark on your Bristol adventure in this delightful 3-bedroom home located at Wellington Terrace. This spacious and meticulously designed space comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests  in a lovely quiet part of Clifton Village - one of Bristol's most renowned areas. Surrounded by numerous cafes, restaurants, and bars, you have all you need to create memorable moments during your stay!
column9: Bristol, a vibrant city in southwest England, offers a diverse range of neighborhoods, each with its own unique character. Clifton, with its elegant Georgian architecture, is known for its leafy streets, boutique shops, and the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge, making it a favorite among professionals and students. The Harbourside is a bustling waterfront area where you can find contemporary apartments, cultural attractions like the M Shed museum, and an array of dining options. Southville, on the south side of the river, is a trendy and artistic neighborhood, while St. Werburghs offers a more bohemian vibe with its community gardens and eclectic community. Overall, Bristol's neighborhoods cater to a wide spectrum of tastes and lifestyles, making it a city full of options for residents and visitors alike.

column9:
The house is nestled on a hillside in the vibrant neighbourhood of Clifton Wood, renowned for its picturesque colourful streets, leafy parks, and friendly locals. It's just a short walk away from a variety of boutique shops, proper pubs, gourmet restaurants and Brunel’s famous Clifton Suspension bridge, providing an authentic Bristol experience.

With an truly special panoramic view of Bristol and its floating harbour, this home offers a unique blend of city living and historical fascination right from your window.
The stunning views of the SS Great Britain, the world's first great ocean liner, provide a captivating backdrop for your stay.

With the SS Great Britain on your doorstep, you'll have the unique opportunity to explore this historic ship and surrounding maritime museum and Bristol's other famous landmarks.

Book your stay now and soak in the rich history, vibrant culture, and undeniable charm that our Clifton Wood home has to offer. We look

column7: Beautiful Family Home in East Bristol
column8:
This large Edwardian family home is located on a peaceful residential road in East Bristol. The house has wide-reaching views across the Frome valley and sits near to Eastville park, a perfect place for dog-walking, running and cycling.
With the local pub near by, cafes and supermarkets on your doorstep, you'll have everything you need to explore, dine, relax & unwind. The city centre is a short bus or taxi ride away and the Bristol-Bath cycle path is quick hop from our front door.
column9:
This house offers the best of both worlds: easy access to the city centre with its world-class museums, restaurants and nightlife, and the chance to enjoy the open green spaces and hip cafes of East Bristol on your doorstep.

The house is situated on a leafy road in the Eastville/Fishponds neighbourhoods. Eastville is a residential, mostly Victorian neighbourhood, home to the very large Eastville park with its lake, recently renovated playpark and Kind Regards coffee van (Fri-Sun). The Frome Valley Way is a 5-min walk from the house and offers a quiet riverside walk or bike ride with frequent sightings of herons and kingfishers. From here you can walk to the historic Snuff Mills, and on to Oldbury Court with its large playpark.

Fishponds has excellent pubs, cafes (FED, Crafty Egg, the Star and newly renovated All In), and supermarkets (Morrisons, Lidl, Sainsburies). Another neighbourhood, Easton, is around 15 minutes walk or shorter bike ride from the house, offeri

This beautiful newly built house sleeps up to 6 and is the perfect place to stay when visiting Bristol for work or leisure.

Located just a 9 minute walk from Temple Meads Train Station and closeby to the main attractions in Bristol where you will find an array of bars and resturants, as well as local attractions, it's in a fantastic spot for guests exploring Bristol.

We manage another property a few doors down in the same location which looks very similar, this is one of two.
column9:
With a rich history spanning centuries, Bristol’s modern day Old Market/Barton Vale district has a unique character built from its vibrant residents and businesses alike. You will discover an eclectic blend of vintage stores and independent shops mixed with cool cafés, bars and restaurants as well as art and music venues. On its doorstep, the bustling bars, cafés, theatres and shops of the city centre are all within easy reach and the renowned Cabot Circus shopping centre is just a short walk away.

Bristol is renowned for its rich heritage and vibrant culture. Birthplace of ‘Banksy’ and home to Brunel’s Clifton Suspension Bridge, Bristol plays host to the Bristol Harbour Festival and Bristol International Balloon Fiesta annually, bringing excitement and colour to this already thriving modern city.

-The Barley Mow pub is ran by Bristol Beer Factory and has 8 cask and 10 keg lines showcasing the best beer as well as a food menu incl

column7: 3 bed house in Bedminster near Wapping Wharf
column8:
This 3-bedroom house is steps away from North street in Bedminster. North street, home of Upfest, is well-known for its colourful 52 murals. The house is a block away from independent shops, great restaurants (including a Michelin-star one), cafes and pubs. You will also be a short walk from Wapping Wharf, the Harbourside, Greville Smyth Park, Ashton Court and Ashton Gate stadium.

Free street parking available.

Easy access to the Bristol airport (15 minute drive or 25 minutes by bus).

column7: Spacious Home in Montpelier, Nr City Centre
column8: Embrace Bristol's charm at this townhouse in Montpelier. Sleeping 8 guests with 4 double bedrooms, it offers a comfortable retreat. The bright & airy master bedroom offers views of the entire city. With 3 bathrooms for convenience, the house ensures privacy & comfort. The living room has a welcoming ambience, featuring a large smart TV & wood burner. There is a well-equipped kitchen for those able to tear themselves from all the local restaurants! Immerse in the vibrant culture of Montpelier.
column9:
This townhouse is tucked away on a quiet street in Montpelier, one of Bristol’s most-loved neighbourhoods. Known for its bohemian vibe, Montpelier feels like a village more than a city suburb. Find vibrant local pubs, incredible restaurants, artisan delis and cafes all a short walk away. Plus, you’re in the prime spot to enjoy all that this vibrant city has to offer, and best yet it’s all reachable by foot!

Stroll alongside the harbour, hopping in and out of art galleries, coffee shops and the renowned M Shed Museum. Or enjoy a bite to eat in the unique Wapping Wharf - this cultural quarter boasts eateries and independent shops all housed in refurbished shipping containers. In summer, there’s nothing better than sitting on the water’s edge and soaking up the lively vibe of this vibrant city.

With so many different neighbourhoods to explore, you can spend days exploring Bristol’s city centre. Wander through Stokes Croft to see colourful graffiti by Bristol-born Ba
column16:
We love welcoming new guests to stay with us. As keen travellers ourselves, we always take note of the things we love about our trips and try to bring those elements to our own spaces. Whether that's through little touches in the house or always being available should you need help or local advice.

After using Airbnb as a guest and host for many years, we decided to put our experience to good use and founded Guesthoo - Cornwall & Devon's first Airbnb management company. Now managing properties all over Cornwall, Devon & the South West, we are wholly committed to ensuring our guests have the best experience possible when staying with us. Search 'Guesthoo' online for more information.

Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music

column9:
Clifton, situated in the heart of Bristol, England, is renowned for its unique blend of historic charm, cultural vibrancy, and scenic beauty. This picturesque suburb is characterized by its elegant Georgian and Victorian architecture, making it a visual treat and a favorite for both residents and visitors.

Key features of Clifton include:

Clifton Suspension Bridge: An iconic symbol of Bristol, this stunning feat of engineering spans the Avon Gorge and offers breathtaking views. Designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, it's a must-visit landmark and a popular spot for photography.

The Architecture: Clifton's streets are lined with grand Georgian and Victorian buildings, many of which have been converted into stylish apartments, boutique shops, and cozy cafes. The architecture adds a timeless elegance to the area.

Clifton Village: The heart of Clifton, known as Clifton Village, boasts a wealth of independent shops, boutiques, bars, and restaurants.

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

column9: Grand Georgian townhouses line the streets and crescents of affluent, leafy Clifton. Our property is in a quiet / peaceful side road just off Whiteladies Road, where you'll find many buzzing bars and restaurants. Nearby Clifton Village is home to upscale boutiques and quirky indie shops. Clifton Downs is- popular for many activities including kite-flying, music events, exercise and walking. Brunel's landmark Clifton Suspension Bridge straddles the Avon Gorge and is a must-see.

column9:
Clifton, located in Bristol, UK, is a picturesque and affluent suburb known for its elegant Georgian architecture, vibrant atmosphere, and stunning views of the Avon Gorge. With its charming streets lined with Georgian and Victorian buildings, Clifton exudes a timeless elegance. The iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge, designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, spans the gorge and offers breathtaking vistas of the surrounding countryside.

The area boasts a lively cultural scene, with trendy cafes, boutique shops, and artisanal eateries scattered throughout. Visitors can explore attractions such as the Clifton Observatory and Caves, offering panoramic views from its rooftop terrace, or stroll through the scenic Clifton Downs and Clifton Village, known for its quaint squares and leafy green spaces.

Clifton is also home to the prestigious University of Bristol, adding a youthful energy to the area. Whether it's enjoying a leisurely walk along the Avon Gorge, admiring the arch

column16:
Hi I'm Lavinia 

I've lived in Bristol for nearly 25 years and I absolutely love living here! I spent my childhood growing up in the Far East so I've done my fair share of travelling, but I still have a hunger for more! I manage a number of properties for family and friends and I love welcoming new visitors. I know the city like the back of my hand so I'd love to tell you about all the things that go on in our vibrant city. I look forward to welcoming you and making your stay one to remember.

 See you soon Lavinia

column9:
Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music

column9:
A "village" within a city. The property is in a quiet residential street with off road parking. A short walk from Bristol city centre which is known for its maritime history, Banksy street art and Cabot Circus Shopping Quarter, as well as its floating bars and restaurants along The Harbourside in the charming Old City.

Castle Park offers greenery and fortress ruins, while the medieval Christmas Steps are packed with quaint shops and cosy pubs. Big-name performers appear at the Old Vic Theatre and the O2 Academy. Whether you are here for work or pleasure if you have any reason to be near the centre of Bristol then this is the perfect location for you.

column9:
The apartment is a few minutes walk from the bustling Gloucester Road, with many bus routes and cycle paths/bus lanes in to the city centre. Gloucester Rd. has many shops, bars and restaurants with varied cuisine for a night out, or a take away. There is a huge choice of restaurants that will deliver to this area via one of the online food ordering apps like Uber Eats, Just Eat or Deliveroo, or via their own website ordering services.

A short taxi or Uber ride of 1.5-1.8 miles will get you in to the heart of Bristol to enjoy great shopping at Cabot Circus or Broadmead. Bristol’s restaurants, bars, entertainment venues, clubs, cinemas, harbourside dining, tourist venues and theatres are all within easy reach of this fabulously located Bristol gem. We recommend Cabot Circus, the Centre, the harbourside development and the Park Street or Clifton Village areas of Bristol for great places to go out or visit.

Located within 20 minutes of Bristol Zoo Project, The Downs,

column9:
Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music

column9:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant

column9:
Sneyd Park is a quiet green suburb of North Bristol.

Just around the corner is a quaint little church, St Mary’s Church, which is open from 9 to 5.

The Downs, an open 400-acre green space, is a short 10 minute walk away. Walking 5 minutes further towards the the Avon Gorge gets you to the Sea Walls viewpoint which overlooks the Clifton Suspension Bridge.

column8: Our home is a charming mid-terrace Victorian house, typical of this area of Bristol. We bought the house in 2023 and have spent the past year making it feel like home. It has original wooden floorboards throughout, with charming period features and a private garden with a table, BBQ and fire pit. Our spacious living room has a wood-burning fire which can be used in the winter months. The master bedroom gets beautiful morning light, and the two spare rooms get lovely views of the garden.

column8:
The stunning façade of this Georgian townhouse features classic symmetrical design, grand sash windows, and a stately entrance adorned with period details.
Upon entering, you are greeted by a spacious and inviting hallway with high ceilings, ornate cornicing, and beautifully restored original features. The ground floor offers a formal living room that exudes charm with its large windows, an original fireplace, and elegant ceiling chandelier. Adjacent to the living room is a sophisticated dining
column9:
Located in the prestigious Clifton area, this Georgian townhouse is within walking distance of Clifton Village, known for its boutique shops, cafes, and restaurants. The property is also close to excellent schools, parks, and transport links, making it an ideal location for families.

This exceptional Georgian townhouse in Clifton offers a rare opportunity to own a piece of history while enjoying the comforts of modern living. Its blend of classic elegance and contemporary amenities makes it a truly unique and desirable home.

column7: Modern Townhouse in Central Bristol w/ Parking
column8: Discover modern comfort at this stylishly furnished townhouse in Southville. Located on a quiet street yet right opposite the city centre, it offers the best of both worlds. Sleeps up to 6 with 2 double bedrooms, 1 queen & sofa bed. All share 1 bathroom with bath/shower and a downstairs WC. The master has sliding doors leading out to a roof terrace with lovely views and seating. Downstairs, find a well-equipped kitchen, dining and living area with smart TV. Includes permit parking for 1 vehicle.
column9:
This modern townhouse is tucked away on a quiet street in Southville, yet conveniently located to enjoy everything Bristol has to offer. Just down the road, you’ll find the bustling North Street, which is packed with pubs, great restaurants, cafes, artisan shops, breweries and more. The Tobacco Factory is at the centre of it all with regular weekend markets and events. Ashton Gate Stadium is also just a short walk further from here.

Cross the bridge over the river Avon and you'll find yourself in the unique Wapping Wharf in minutes - this cultural quarter boasts eateries and independent shops all housed in refurbished shipping containers. From here, stroll alongside the harbour, hopping in and out of art galleries, coffee shops and the renowned M Shed Museum. In summer, there’s nothing better than sitting on the water’s edge and soaking up the lively vibe of the city.

With so many different neighbourhoods to explore, you can spend days exploring Bristol’s city cen

Whether that's through little touches in the house or always being available should you need help or local advice.

After using Airbnb as a guest and host for many years, we decided to put our experience to good use and founded Guesthoo - Cornwall & Devon's first Airbnb management company. column9:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant
column16: Prescott Apartments main aim is to provide travellers with the "home away from home" feeling they require. column7: Bristol Art BnB
column8:
Large house with easy transport links to Bristol and Bath. Clean, light and airy featuring different artists/artwork, plenty of greenery, a garden and driveway. All newly decorated.
The local area boasts all amenities including great cafes and a deli on Sandy Park Road.
50 metres from the front door is a TIER scooter and bike hire point and bus stop for Bristol and Clifton.
In 10 mins you are in central Bristol boasting the Suspension Bridge, Banksy artworks and lots more.
column16:
I have lived and worked in Bristol for almost 30 years and love it. The diversity is great with loads of different eating and drinking options, plus alternative cinema, theatre, kids stuff, sports stuff etc etc - any recommendations needed, please ask.
The Art BnB idea came from growing up with an artist, and being surrounded by a thriving arts scene in Bristol, wanting to be more involved in looking after the house and showing art I enjoyed too.

column16:
HI,
I'm a 45-year-old Irish girl (woman?!), who loves travelling and, while I don't have as much opportunity to as I used to, I still love exploring new places and meeting lots of different kinds of people. I work as a teacher, and in my (rare) spare time, I love being outdoors, going to live music gigs and hanging out with friends at Bristol's great cafes and restaurants. The older I get, the better life seems to get I'm  finding :)

column9:
Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music
column16: Prescott Apartments main aim is to provide travellers with the "home away from home" feeling they require. We aim to make your stay quick, easy and enjoyable.

column7: Eccentric & Quirky Three Bed  St George, Bristol
column8:
Situated in the heart of the community in St George, Bristol is this newly renovated three bedroom apartment. Its quirky decor seamlessly blend with modern design to create a well-balanced home.

This property is walking distance to independently owned shops and eateries, St George park and the Orchard Coffee & Co.

This lovely three bedroom apartment is the perfect place to stay in Bristol, although out of the centre it boasts free street parking and good transport links to Bristol & Bath.
column9:

column7: 1841 Georgian Townhouse, Parking x 1, Clifton
column8:
Please see our 2 other Airbnbs for further availability and bed options. All listings independent / not shared. The penthouse is a top 10% Airbnb 🏆

Just off Whiteladies Road, near the cinema.

Impressively decorated. On the ground floor of a historical Georgian period townhouse built in 1841. In a safe, affluent, well-located part of the city.

Near centre, university main campus, Park Street, Suspension bridge & Clifton Village. Temple Meads station a short bus ride.

Garden / city views
column9: Grand Georgian townhouses line the streets and crescents of affluent, leafy Clifton. Our property is in a quiet / peaceful side road just off Whiteladies Road, where you'll find many buzzing bars and restaurants. Nearby Clifton Village is home to upscale boutiques and quirky indie shops. Clifton Downs is- popular for many activities including kite-flying, music events, exercise and walking. Brunel's landmark Clifton Suspension Bridge straddles the Avon Gorge and is a must-see.

column7: higgihaus 3a 4 Bed Small groups
column8: Stylish house that accommodates groups of up to 8. Located in Stokes Croft, the city’s most ‘hip and happening’ neighbourhood!
column9: The higgihaus@cheltenhamlane (#3a) sits in a hidden no-through lane and is a mere stone's throw from the Cheltenham and Gloucester Roads. Both are chock full of shops, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, pubs, supermarkets and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Montpelier). Stokes Croft (famed for its street art) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the independent traders on the Gloucester Road (known locally as Bristol's Indie Shopping District) a couple of minutes in the other.
column16:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

column8: We love our colourful fun family home on a quiet street in a lovely neighbourhood in Bristol. Big kitchen that gets sun all day, fun garden for BBQs and kids, pretty lounge with big sofa and bay window bench for relaxing afternoon sun. The street is quiet but only 20 mins walk from the city centre, 10 mins walk to the fun vibrant shops and restaurants of Gloucester Rd (Europe's longest street of independent shops!) and  5 mins walk from St Andrews park and Narroways nature reserve.

column7: Totterdown House with Views & Garden
column8:
This fantastic newly renovated home in one of Totterdown's colourful Victorian houses with free street parking.

There is a master bedroom with a king size bed, a second double bedroom and a third bedroom with twin beds. There are two bathrooms, one upstairs and a second downstairs.

The garden has three dining areas with plenty of seating options to enjoy the spectacular views across Totterdown and beyond.

Totterdown has great pubs, grocery stores and eateries all on your doorstep.
